Reviews.Title: “Very Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: CAMAROSA
Reviews.Content: Stayed last weekend and found the hotel perfect - location, quiet room. Out the front door and you are in PARIS - rue Cler is a lively place. You can walk to the Eiffel Tower in 10 minutes. Take the shuttle service to the airport. On Sunday they can take you through the centre of town - better than a tour! Would recommend the hotel to anyone wanting an autehntic Parisan experience

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: B0yzM0m
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best place I have stayed in Paris. If anyone is whining about there experience here, carefully consider the source. If you are looking for a U.S. style oversized Hilton room, then go somewhere else (or better yet stay home.). As someone who has traveled around Europe, I will tell you that this is a truly delightful hotel. It is a cozy, welcoming, warm and inviting. The beds are comfortable, the linen crisp and clean, and the bathroom spotless. The rooms are quiet and if you need anything, it's all within a block of the hotel. The staff is helpful and patient. The prices are very reasonable for Paris. I am currently writing from the hotel on my last of 4 nights (free wifi) and regret having to say goodbye.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mollyrae
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, and a double on the weekend was only 115 euros/night. The hotel staff was plenty friendly, even when I checked in at 12:30 in the morning! Please don't let those previous negative reviews throw you off. The rooms were beautiful and clean, and the wifi worked well. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in while in Europe; the sheets were as soft as could be! We didn't order breakfast at the hotel, as there was a fantastic boulangerie at the end of the block selling tasty pastries. In short, I don't have a single complaint about this hotel-- just be sure to book early, as their 25 rooms fill up quickly!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cozy”
Reviews.Author: Dada C
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a tad bit small, but its a botique hotel and in Paris so that was a given. Very near the Eiffel tower and the Rue Cler area is a fantastic place to stay... near cafes and bakeshops... there is a nice convenience store... accessible via subway to almost anywhere in Paris.. Bathrooms are exceptionally clean and beds are comfy and soft... I think there were complimanetary sweets/bonbons when we arrived. I wish I could have stayed longer...

Reviews.Title: “For a real Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: Barbara D
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel du Champ de Mars in February. It was such a wonderful place to stay.The owners were very helpful and made us feel at home.The room was beautiful.The view fantastic! To watch the lights of the Eiffel Tower from your room was special.Location was great with an easy walk to the metro and bus stops.We also enjoyed the place to eat across the street.If you are one of the luckey ones that get to stay at this great place give an extra pet to the cocker spanial in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wheatenfool
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights and we're thrilled that our choice of hotels was perfect for our trip. All of the previous reviews were spot on. One piece of advice: ask the owners about their cocker Channelle (?sp) and the reception warms up!

Reviews.Title: “Great room/breakfast/location”
Reviews.Author: Jerome J
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful eight night stay at this French boutique hotel. The service was excellent-evident in the making of dinner reservations, directions/info, an awesome breakfast (served in-room or cellar dining room) and cleanliness. The classic French maid uniforms worn by the staff were a whimsical surprise. The small rooms (who needs a large room while touring Paris? You should be out & about except for sleep & a shower.) were tastefully appointed with modern, designer bathroom fixtures. The beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel is conveniently located 1 1/2 blocks from the "ecole militaire" metro stop. The immediate neighborhood has most all of the shops necessary to accomodate the local Parisians-cafés, natural foods grocer, butcher, cheese shop, bakery, wine, seafood shop, pharmacy, bookstore, etc. all with a bit slower pace than other parts of Paris-comfortable, laid back feel. The street in front is only for pedestrians, bicycle or motorcycles-fairly quiet. We'll be back! Jerome & Christopher

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Paris wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: MikeMary1728
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The owners are polite,accommodating,helpful,nice,and we're never rude.Our room was clean comfortable, and just enough room.(we read reviews about rooms being small) We had requested a courtyard room with twin beds and got just what we asked for.We did book three months in advance. You are required to leave your room key at the front desk when you leave for the day. Don't worry your things are safe. 2 minute walk to metro,10 minutes to Eiffel Tower. Great restaurants,bakery,chocolate,cheese,andwine shops all at your front door. This area is fun and safe. I will make this my home when my wife and I go back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the Rue Clere district”
Reviews.Author: lchiv
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel du Champs de Mars. I was not disappointed, I had long wanted to stay here but at peak times it was always booked up, but this time we were lucky. The room was delightful and the service first class. The breakfast was great value. We will definitely stay here next time we stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: maggie b
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just returned from a trip to Europe that included a 4 night stay at Hotel du Champ de Mars. It was absolutely our favorite stay of our two week trip. The room was just lovely. You can tell there is much attention to detail here! We felt very welcomed from everyone we came into contact with. They even have their dog there during the day =) Just like home! We enjoyed everything about this hotel from the location, to the decor, to the people! You could even see the Eiffel tower from our room! Very accommodating! Great rates! LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Small, quite, much more than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Jeeperz46
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this wonderful little hotel for 6-nights with our granddaughter, (our second stay) and had a wonderful time. It is small but comfortable, very clean and quiet. With the rue Cler market at your doorstep, there is always good pastries, cappuccinos, and fun shopping at your fingertips. You can walk everywhere, and if you can't walk there, the Metro station is just around the corner. Get to know Stephane and Francoise. They are friendly and helpful. We are headed back there this coming September. Can't wait! Profitez de votre séjour...

Reviews.Title: “Adorable boutique hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Teri S
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful stay at the Hotel du Champ de Mars and cannot say enough about it! I received a very friendly, warm greeting when I arrived after a tiring day of travel. The room was very clean, including an impeccably clean bathroom. What I really noticed was how quiet the room was, especially at night. Also, unlike other stays in European hotels, the bed was very comfortable. I truly loved my stay here! Hotel du Champ de Mars could not be in a better location! Arr 7 is a very quaint and quiet district anyway, but this location right off the Rue Cler made it feel like you were a local. There are plenty of cafe options right down the street from the hotel and we were never disappointed with the selections. The Metro is not even 2 blocks away, a post office is on the corner, and a bank across the street from that. All travel amenities in a 2 block radius, which was very helpful! I will definitely stay at the Hotel du Champ de Mars again! LOVED IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little Parisian hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CashsGirl
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! I was worried about them losing our reservation because of some of the other reviews. Also I was nervous because air France went on strike causing us to find other flights in the middle of our trip and we didn't arrive at our hotel until after 1am. But they had everything ready for us! Our room was clean and beautiful, just what I would've wished for in Paris. I thought the decor was very Parisian looking too. Yes, the room was small...but after a lot of European travel it's what I've come to expect. The shower wasn't my favorite since the door covered only half of the tide of the tub. So there was always water on the bathroom floor. They don't tell you online that there are hair dryers in the rooms so I brought mine. You don't need to. Also they sell the Paris museum pass at the front desk which is nice! If you stay there try the macaroons at the place across the street...they're so good!

Reviews.Title: “Are we glad we booked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: M B
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel du Champ de Mars by going to Rick Steves' site, then checking peoples' reviews of various hotels. This hotel seemed to have garnered the best reviews for those in our price range, so I made reservations for three nights. The last time I found and booked a hotel in Europe, we ended up in a plywood loft (advertised as a 'private room') with the space below serving as a walk-through to the larger dorm area. So, I was a bit leery in spite of the reviews about what we'd find when we arrived. What we found? An amazing, lovely hotel with owners and staff helpful and courteous. Our room was spotless, fresh, and welcoming. Yes, it was small but a perfect size for a comfortable bed with bedside tables and excellent reading lights (a big plus where I'm concerned), a round table that served as our wine and cheese 'bar' with a chair and stool, and a large closet with shelves. The immaculate bathroom was en suite and even included a small tub, which I did use. Another huge plus of this hotel is the location, basically on Rue Cler. Rick Steves had noted this as the quintessential French street experience, and it was wonderful. Coffee, pastries, cheese, wine, pharmacy, chocolates... everything was within a few minutes stroll from our hotel's door. We discovered several cafes we really enjoyed, one being on the corner diagonally across from Hotel du Champ de Mars, Cafe du Marche. Another was at the end (Cafe Rouissilon) where the salads were great. We had dinner at Petit Cler where we were made to feel we were part of the local scene versus just tourists. Our neighboring diners lived in the area and were warm and open. Wherever we ate, the food and service were excellent and the local company friendly. When we'd return to the hotel after a day of visiting sites and just walking around, our room was as if we'd just arrived (minus our clothes and items) – clean and inviting. Due to the Air France strike we got 'stuck' in Paris; fortunately, our hotel could put us up for an extra night, which was great as I doubt we would have found another place we would have liked as much. We can't say enough about how wonderful this hotel, owners, and staff were, including their gentle and tranquil pup, Cannelle. We've posted a few photos, but they don't do it justice. Just writing about our time there makes us want to book a visit each year, if only to stay in Hotel du Champ de Mars and enjoy the ambiance of Rue Cler.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and great value”
Reviews.Author: 1travel123
Reviews.Content: You are right in the Rue Cler neighborhood and you are super close to the Eiffel Tower. You are close to the metro; but most rides require a transfer. I stayed in a single and the room was very small; especially the bathroom/shower. However, it was around $100 and for a boutique hotel I can't complain. The front desk service was "Parisian". I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little home base”
Reviews.Author: imtoast
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights in Sept '11, and could not have been more pleased with this little hotel. It served as a perfect home base from which to branch out and explore Paris either on foot or metro. Clean, comfortable, close to major sights and metro stations, your own little market street around the corner, even a great cafe right across the street called Le Sancerrois with a very kind, patient owner and her son...I could not have asked for more. (Well maybe a small fridge in the room). A word on the staff: I know most of the negative TA reviews have been centered on the perceived rudeness of the staff, including the owners. I understand the desire to be greeted with a big smile and a friendly "Bonjour!" This probably won't happen at Champ, and I urge potential guests to get over it. These are professional people - respectful, serious, but not rude. I found owner Francoise to be very curteous. Slyn at the desk is great and this is the guy you want to ask your questions of. Would I have preferred a hug from other owner Stephane instead of the scowl I got at checkout? Sure. But c'est la vie.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MainelyPatrick
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to Rue Cler, Eiffel Tour and Metro. Very clean room with very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's still charming & our home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lamhk
Reviews.Content: We stay again for 6 nights in this little gem. So, the expectation is high and we just still enjoy the stay so much. Stephane just keep up with the standard & it's not an easy job. Rue cler is so perfect with great & best-deal cafe & bistro. Yes, it may be noisy but you won't complain when you experienced the atmosphere. The only drawback is it's so fully booked but the good thing need to be shared.

Reviews.Title: “"a tres chic small hotel in a tres chic part of paris"”
Reviews.Author: waterbird62
Reviews.Content: I borrowed Stephen W's title, since it fits the description of this lovely little hotel perfectly! The owners Françoise and Stéphane run and manage personally this little gem in the 7° arrond. located between the eiffel tower and invalides literally around the corner (2 steps)from rue cler and one of paris's small and picturesque food markets located in this upscale residential neighbourhood. The hotel itself has all the qualities and ambience of an upscale little boutique hotel , with the rooms perfectly and charmingly decorated with all your basic needs catered too and thought of. The size are "parisian" meaning a french size dbl bed , which one could also describe as "romantically cosy". In addition a part of the philosophy of the owners,is to charge a flat rate per room the whole year round(which is extremely reasonable and fair for this area and quality of service even in low season, let's not discuss high season! ) This alone deserves a "hotel management/owner oscar award" and a special medal from the paris tourism board in our opinion!!!. Paris is always a special city and a magic city no matter when, but our 5 day stay in paris was made espeicially comfortable and pleasurable since we had the good fortune to reserve the very last room available , and be able to wake up or come back for a little rest/relax in this charming and comfortable ambience before setting off happily refreshed for dinner .Located in this area are also a wide selection of small cafès (all very typical french) and a variety of restaurants and bistros..ranging from crepes, to korean to modern to classic french cuisine and everything in between,meaning that you have a great range of dinner choices literally at your doorstep or around the corner. The neighbourhood is flowing with a natural daily rythym of life and convenient to reach all other points of interest or neighbourhoods of paris either by a nice stroll (the best way to see any city) or metro or RER. An area with wonderful mix of locals and relaxed tourists ( i like to think intellegient tourists)..without the tour buses or tourist swarms/hoards that other areas often have. p.s i almost didn't want to add my review, since in my experience this hotel is already almost always fully booked by regular guests who come back year after year , or friends of friends who are recomended! The next time we are in paris, i hope we will be just as lucky as we were this time and be able to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “A tres chic hotel in a tres chic part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Stephen W
Reviews.Content: A very initimate, tastefully decorated, very clean small hotel. If you want a real taste of Parisian life this is the place to stay. Rooms are comfortable, clean and nicely decorated. They are adequate in size but not overly large. The owners and your hosts, are very pleasant and helpful. I have stayed here a number of times for both business and pleasure, with family and by myself. I have never been disappointed. And the extra benefit is that you are right in hte heart of the Rue Cler,perhaps the best kept secret in all of Paris, but not for much longer, I'm sure. You are a short walk from the Eiffel Tower and many other sights. Cafes and gourmet restaurants abound. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: Susan122
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from 3 nights in the hotel. Everything was just great: location, room and breakfast.Bars and restaurants on the doorstep so no need to trek far after a tiring day walking round the sights. The breakfast was excellent for 8 euro and even the breakfast girls added comedy value for their slower than slow service - nothing to rush for however. Altogether a fabulous French experience.

Reviews.Title: “Two sides to every story...”
Reviews.Author: ORGinH
Reviews.Content: Here's a review of a hotel in which I never spent a night. We arrived of a July afternoon after a long day's travel from Provence. Our booking had been made by the French-speaking member of our party. Confirmed by email, then two (2) attempted re-confirmations by voice message to the hotel. If you read the "terrible" reviews you can guess that upon arrival we had no reservation. There were a few volleys of "Ce n'est pas ma faute!" until we produced the hard copies of the email confirmations. At that point the owner, Mme Goundal swung into action. She marched us (literally) to her sister's hotel, The Hotel de Londres Eiffel, and somehow managed to get us the rooms we needed for the length of time required at the price originally booked at the Hotel Du Champ De Mars. I will try the Hotel Du Champ De Mars again (location is fantastic) based on the recovery from the booking error, but be forewarned, the reservation system still needs some work. Keep copies of emails and if you call make sure you are talking to the owner.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: davidobrien
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Champ de Mars is only a 15 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. As a matter of fact we could actually see the tip of the tower from our hotel room window. The hotel is very clean, modern, tastefully done in a nice quiet section of town with plenty of incredible cafe´s and restaurants in the area. The staff were not exactly cordial but not rude either, kind of a friendly indifference if you will but it did not matter. What mattered to me was the cleanliness of the hotel and the price. I couldn´t believe that this place was only a 100 euros per night. I wanted to do something special for my daughter´s 10 year birthday and this little haven did not disappoint. The rooms were not exactly large but also not too small. I have no complaints especially considering the location and it´s proximity to the major attractions of Paris. From now on until my budget increases this will be the place I stay when I come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely suprise!”
Reviews.Author: michelle h
Reviews.Content: A lovely, beautifully decorated hotel in a great location - so close to markets, restaurants and transport. My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights in November to celebrate my 40th birthday. Our room was spotless and on the third floor facing the street - great for people watching. We had breakfast there most days which was good value and delicious. I miss those croissants and baguettes! This hotel was a delight to come back to after a long day walking all over Paris and we would definitely stay there again. We found the owners to be polite and friendly and work very long hours. I enjoyed our conversations with them and they were very helpful to us arranging taxis and shuttles. Thankyou Francoise and Stephane for a lovely stay in your charming Parisian hotel. Nevil and Michelle Hunter, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Rue Cler gem (and affordable!)”
Reviews.Author: SandyKowalchik
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this small hotel right in the heart of the Rue Cler area. Great value, very pleasant innkeepers (and their dog!) made our stay in Paris comfortable. We've stayed in this area several times before and it is still the best way to go in Paris. Walking distance to great dining, fab shopping and local charm in a major european city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the location”
Reviews.Author: Nancy from MI
Reviews.Content: This little gem is tucked away just off Rue Cler and is such a good value in a popular neighborhood. Our room was always clean. The rooms are different than what we are used to in the States, but was enough room for my husband and I as you are only in your room to sleep and shower. The location is the greatest, I love the Rue Cler area, great places to shop and eat. It is very close to the Eiffel Tower, just a few blocks away and close to the Metro station and bus stops. Everyone was very pleasant as are most Parisians. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in this area of Paris. All three of the times I have been to Paris, this is the area I prefer to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Charming”
Reviews.Author: Marilee B
Reviews.Content: The location of this charming hotel is perfect for anyone wanting to visit Paris. Close to many attractions with the Metro just down the street for longer trips. The Breakfast offered is the best deal for the money. Lots of coffee, breads, fruit and yogurt. Served in your room or the downstairs breakfast room. Elevator provided for those who can't climb stairs. The staff is friendly and will do all they can to make your stay enjoyable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “well placed small hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosemaryoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this hotel in mid October, and found it to be perfectly located for walking all over central Paris. It's 10 mins walk to the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides, or Rodin's gallery, or to the Grand Palais. And we could easily catch the Metro nearby, or jump on the Bateaubus down at the river. The rooms are very small but nicely decorated and super clean. Nearly all Paris hotel rooms are small, and for a single traveller, at this price, they are fine. It's a good hotel for women travellers as it's central but safe, even strolling around in the evenings. We enjoyed nearby restaurants such as Pasco and La Cuisine, and both represented great value at their price points. My only downside is that the staff seemed a bit offhand and distant, except for the helpful man who met us at our taxi on day 1.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: De_Puerto_Rico
Reviews.Content: I traveled for the first time to Paris in October. I travelled solo and felt safe going in and out of the hotel area. The owners are very helpful. I arrived in Paris at 9:00 AM, dropped off my bags and went out to explore Paris. It was very easy to take the RER from the airport. I bought a Paris Visite Pass and used it all day to explore the city and get oriented. It is probably cheaper to buy a ticket to Paris from the airport and then a Paris Visite Zone 1 and 2. The hotel is just steps away from Rue Clear, where there are nice restaurants and many markets. The hotel is also very convenient to the train that goes to Versailles. Before you go to Paris, I recommend to find out the train that you need to take: by color, number or letter,and by final destination. I also printed out the directions from the station to the hotel, and found the hotel very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Charming area”
Reviews.Author: TanteTynne
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet, clean hotell. Helpful staff. Nice rooms. The area is very charming with food markets and lots of cafés and bistrots right next door in Rue Cler. Try the Bar du Marche, or a bit further up, rue Cler, Le Petit Cler. Great location, though personally I find the Latin quarter more central - it's closer (as in walking distance) to the "essentials". Would definitely recommend, though.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Stay In Paris”
Reviews.Author: Edmarkquart
Reviews.Content: We were four couples who stayed at this hotel for four nights in September, 2011. It was superb. The best. A big bang for the buck. The rooms. The service. The location. The ambience. The neighborhood. It was all superb. Ed Markquart, Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Affordable lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cho N
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between the October 2011. Nice lovely 2 star hotel in the heart of Paris with easy access to the metro and RER. The surrounding neighbour is busy and lively with lovely cafes,local shops and restuarants ( but not overly busy , so ideal for a quiet break) . The hotel is reasonably priced and quite cute. I stayed in a single room ( Rm 52 on top floor) and it was nice and tidy; it wasn't too small but unfortunately looked out to the back. The bathroom was modern and immaculate. I would say the hotel is very good value for money and I would stay here again. However, i would advise against the 8 euros which wasn't worth the money in my opinion and the satellite TV has no english subtitles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Greatfind4748
Reviews.Content: Great location; close to the Ecole Militaire Metro. While the rooms are small, the venue is quite and very close to major attractions. The staff was helpful and the hotel was very clean. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value by the tower”
Reviews.Author: PrincessFiona27
Reviews.Content: We spent our last nite at Hotel du Champ de Mars because we wanted to try a different area. It was an easy check in with the owner being very kind and forgiving my terrible french. The dog cinnamon is a pleasure to pet if you are missing your fur babies. The bright spot was having a lift. Yes, it is normal size for Paris and that means small but we loved it. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are spotless with free internet and the location to the tower, easy. The metro is a just two blocks away. We had an inside room and really got a great nite sleep. They had shampoo and body was and very nice bathroom. All for 100 Euro. This is a favorite of Rick Steve's and we see it fits for a clean, nice hotel in Paris for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in the 7th”
Reviews.Author: darrennelson
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel in the past but on recent trips to Paris have stayed at 5 star hotels so we were not sure what we would think this time around. Champ de Mars is a very small, no frills hotel but in a great location. The rooms are small, no fridges, no ice maker, no AC though they do have wi-fi. They also now an elevator which is handy with luggage vs the stairs. The rooms were nicer than we reminder .. pretty sure they renovated. Our room was facing the road with a partial tower view .. these rooms can be loud with the cafes below. Bathrooms were good .. just wish there was more water pressure. The location is great ... lots of cafes, love Rue Cler and all the shops. Eiffel tower close by and some of the best restaurants in town in walking distance. We do love the location, and this hotel is good but we prefer the Relais Bosquet in this area. I would say based on price and location, this hotel cannot be beat. We may consider staying here again in the future on trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBird81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in the Rue Cler area with lots of little cafes around. Our favourite was the Tribeca restaurant which had great pasta. Cafe du March was also good. The room was very small but clean. The male host was friendly and we had organised a taxi to take us to the train station the following day. In the morning we went downstairs to check out and the female host gave us the fright of our lives and said she doesn't book taxi's! We explained that we had booked one last night with the man at the desk and then she said she saw the booking. Some other poor people were sitting in the foyer waiting for their taxi which hadn't shown up and the hotel got a call that it would be late. Luckily our taxi showed up and got us to the train station on time. From the bad taxi/transport experiences other reviewers have had it sounds like you need to book taxi's and get to train stations and airports well in advance of when you need to be there to avoid stress. There were a lot of other hotels in the area so I would try another one next time around. Be alert when you walk around tourist spots like the Eiffel Tower, these little children run up to you with smiles on their faces and clip boards - they want your money and won't take no for an answer. Don't bother trying to be polite, they don't speak English anyway and interpret any smiles as yes we want you to continue harassing us. Use body language to suggest you are not interested and keep walking. A gang of young boys grabbed my sister and she had to push one off her - they ran away. We had a great time visiting Paris Disneyland - we bought discount tickets online before leaving home for half the usual price.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: copperhead71
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small and there is no AC, but the beds were comfortable, the rooms clean, the staff pleasant, and the location simply perfect. We arrived well before check-in time at around 9a and had no problem leaving our bags and doing some sight-seeing while we waited for our room to be ready. The staff were all very helpful and the premises well-maintained. I loved being with walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, the metro, multiple wonderful restaurants (please try Cafe Constant!), and food shops, yet I felt like we were far from the tourist mob. Hotel du Champ de Mars is small and basic, but it is a great value for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: svice
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel before check in hours and we allowed to store our luggage by the front desk. Our room was so cute and comfortable! It overlooked the street which at first I was worried about the noise level at night. After leaving Nice where we had a very noisy apartment I was hesitant. The front desk assured me it would be a quiet room. He was correct! My only complaint was there was one iron and ironing board for the entire hotel. So we all had to share basically. I didnt have the energy to iron all of my clothes as once so I just made do as the weekend went along. The breakfast was wonderful especially for 8 euros. The location of the hotel is perfect!!! Everything is close and lots of fun places to eat and shop. The staff was helpful when you had questions. Although I wanted directions to the outdoor market and was sent to St. Germain area of town where there are plenty of cute boutique style shops but not the out door market I had in mind. That was ok. we looked around and changed our plans for the day and headed to Museum Orrsay which was a short walk from where we were. It ended up being one of my favorite things I did on this trip so not a bad diversion. Upon our departure we arranged with the front desk for the shuttle to take us to the airport. The driver showed up 25 minutes early and we werent even close to being ready. He decided to go pick up other passangers and come back to get us. Well Monday morning in Paris is a very busy place so he never made it back to pick us up. The front desk (I wish I could remember his name!!) tried to find us a taxi as he felt horrible about our situation. After about 45 minutes and still no taxi he gave my husband 15 euros which is the difference in cost of a taxi vs a shuttle! Yes even in Paris this happened!!! Needless to say he was not going to give up until he found us a taxi and he did!!! We mde it to the airport with only a moment to spare as we were the very last couple allowed to check in!!! This was mostly due to the worlds slowest taxi driver we've ever had.... that part wasnt the fault of the front desk. Anyway, the hotel is darling, then entrire staff were pleasant and courtious.Would deffinilty stay again! Hopefully soon one day!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value - great location”
Reviews.Author: mplsfoode
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in Room 4 and had a wonderful experience. The location is immediately off Rue Cler, a quaint area with wonderful restaurants and cafes. It was very convenient to the Metro (Ecole Militaire line) which we used to travel to other parts of the city for sight-seeing. It was a quick walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Army Museum/Napoleon's Tomb. Our room was nicely furnished and opened up to a small courtyard, which we found added to the great ambience. There was free Wi-Fi. A few negatives: our room was very small - not much room for unpacking and getting organized. Also, the staff wasn't all that helpful. Considering the price, we found this to be a great value and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely...”
Reviews.Author: mariek64
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely seven day stay at this hotel last week. We were given a room on the second floor (one flight up) facing the street. The weather was perfect for opening the windows and we enjoyed the activity out on the street; watching the children walk to school and observing the cafe scene across and down the street. The cafes could be noisy but when the windows were closed, they did a very good job of shutting out the noise. The staff was pleasant and the property well maintained and nicely decorated. I felt the price of our room was very reasonable for the quality of the hotel and the neighborhood. I reserved 9 months in advance and reconfirmed my reservation a 2-3 weeks before our trip. I would love to stay here again. This was a great neighborhood for our first visit to Paris. The Rue Cler is very picturesque market street with several great restaurants. We really like the food at Le Roussillon, Le Petit Cler, and Cafe Du Marche and TribeCa.

Reviews.Title: “Seventh stay here and always good”
Reviews.Author: AusTravellers7
Reviews.Content: A great location around the corner from the Rue Cler. There you will find local cages and food stores. Hotel has small but very comfortable rooms which have recently been redone. They previously were very good anyway. Small lift - any lift in Paris is a bonus. Good breakfast served in basement. Very hard to improve on this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Value, location, and charm!”
Reviews.Author: EHeesacker
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Champs de Mars was the perfect hotel for our recent romantic getaway. My husband and I celebrated our 5th anniversary with a trip to Paris. A friend recommended this hotel as a great value, no frills hotel in a convenient location in Paris. We were very happy with this hotel. The location at the corner of Champs de Mars and Rue Cler was perfect! We were able to stroll Rue Cler for morning coffee, fresh fruit, crepes, and even find nice restaurants for dinner. The hotel is close to the metro but also within walking distance to Champs Elyees and Eiffle Tower. This is not a fancy hotel. There is no room service, no pool, no spa, no AC, no refrigerator so if you need those things in your vacation hotel, this might not be for you. But, if you're looking to find a clean hotel with friendly staff and a little charm that won't break the bank, this is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “charming, good location - great choice”
Reviews.Author: xerete
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and restaurants and shops. We definitely will return.

Reviews.Title: “Our Charming Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: 56JLH13
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at this hotel in August, 2011. Our third floor room was charming and well-serviced daily. The owners and the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The location is ideal: the Eiffel Tower is very close and bridges across the Seine close as well. We even had a view of the tower from our hotel window. Adjacent Rue Cler has many appealing restaurants and shoppes. Recommended completely.

Reviews.Title: “Would have loved to stay here”
Reviews.Author: M&MCanucks
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Hotel before and like it very much. In February I reserved a room for 5 nights, sending my VISA information and received a confirmation. Last week I sent them an email asking if it was possible to extend our stay by one day and they stated they had no reservation for us and they were booked for September!! They then asked me to send proof by sending the email where they confirmed it. I did, it did not matter, they were booked and had no reservation so too bad. Can you imagine that! too bad! I am so glad that I had to send that email asking a question or we would have showed up and had no reservation at all and then we would have had to settle for something else quickly. They were not apologetic, did not admit there error (even when I showed them proof). I hope no one encounters this problem when they arrive as there reservation system seems to be very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, friendly and bijou in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Misskitty360
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in this friendly little hotel. Small but really pretty rooms, with nice new bathrooms. The location is superb, just round the corner from buzzing pedestrian streets with lots of cafes and shops, plus a short walk from the Eiffel Tower. Friendly staff and all went very smoothly - would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “One of Our Favorite Places”
Reviews.Author: WIDSGAL
Reviews.Content: This came highly recommended in Rick Steve's book--and now I know why. Attractive accomodations--and the location is fabulous! Walking distance to the Eifel Tower and two coffee shops across the street. A lovely bakery on the corner with a new favorite-giant meringue cookies! We were traveling light (without electronics). They let us use a laptop in our room to access email etc. We arrived early and were able to just leave our backpacks at the front desk. Highly recommend this hotel! (We stayed in rooms that face the front and the back. I think the back is much quieter. Paris is lively after dark!)

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel and Wonderful Owners!”
Reviews.Author: mandy1411
Reviews.Content: What a delightful place to stay--lovely decor, helpful owners--Francoise and Stephan, great location. The neighborhood is such fun--great cafes, friendly staffs, shops, outdoor markets of food and flowers and atmosphere galore!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay, great decor.”
Reviews.Author: TzTravellor
Reviews.Content: It's definitely much smaller than it looks on their website. Everything's 'petit' as the french would say it. But this place has charm and personality if you're love things like that. Hotel itself is 200 years old, pre-Eiffel... pre-Moulin Rouge, can you imagine. Yet, everything looks spanking new, and the Rooms are very clean. French Boudoir style, but in white. The bath room is small, but you'll be impressed by all the love and details and the magic packed into a small space. We love the decor. From the mirror to the flush, the tap to the shower, the tiles on the floor, to the picture hung on the wall. the chair by the window which overlooks the top part of the Eiffel Tower (yes, it's that close to the Tower). Even the house maids are dressed in French Maid uniforms. Their rooms have names. On the tiny table is a letter to guests, sharing with you the legacy of their hotel, telling you about their pet dog, and their house rules (no smoking, no hanging of laundry). That's nice. It has rules. I'm not sure what you all feel about that. But it lends a lot of character to the place, I feel. The magic is in the details. It has a little lift that only fits two person. The big window in the lobby with the sunlight shining in to light the furniture. All these things helped us to feel the spirit of Paris. The owner herself, a french lady in her 50s, sits at the front desk. It's only the last day that we managed to warm up to her. I told her how I love the details and she giggled, telling me that she personally matched and chose the colours and the decorations of the hotel. She laughed at herself, telling us she's a little crazy and particular about colours, showing us her matching orange bag and orange shoes. And then, our taxi came, and she bid us farewell. If you like places with a personal touch, with a flavour, and a charm, this place is for you. But if you need space, i suggest you find somewhere else. All in all, a fabulous stay, dare i say, a romantic one, especially if you want to be close to the Eiffel Tower. Have a great stay and say hi to the owner for me if you're there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location! 100% Charm.”
Reviews.Author: Passportstampaddict3
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews are on point. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Ecole Militaire metro stop which is on a central line so the transfers are typically few. Check in was easy, just gave my name and got a key! The front desk is helpful but at the end of the day they consider themselves a front desk, NOT a concierge, so recommendations for tours and restaurants are hard to come by. I had a single room which was very clean. It may seem small but one person really does not need that much space. I had a charming window that looked out onto the surrounding buildings and the fresh smells of the nearby cafes would waft in. Lovely. They have a laptop you can borrow which is nice but no printer. My only two dislikes would be the system of "holding" a room. Sending all that information in an e-mail is an extreme risk and in a country where you sign for the smallest CC (even metro tickets) purchase it's surprising they would ask for such delicate details. My other dislike was that you turned in your key whenever you left, not because I didn't want to but upon returning one night at around 1am from being with friends the desk clerk was not at their post. The front door gets locked at night and it appeared that I woke him up from sleep because he was none too pleased about having to open the door. Sorry, it's a hotel, I believe I have the right to come and go as I wish. If they prefer people not to arrive after a certain hour, it should be posted. Overall I very much enjoyed the trip. The area is FAB! Lots of great cafes without tons of tourists. However, young travelers beware, they don't have much tolerance for people returning after hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: WichitaViajero
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days in Mach 2011, we had red and researche so much about it. it was the perfect location for exploring around the Eifel Tower, the metro was about a block and a half away. Grocery store next door, Rue cler 1/2 block away, the location was great! the #1 rated restaurant by trip advisor in Paris, it's about1/2 a block away, it's call Marieta, we tried to eat there, it was closed. Maybe you will be so fortunate to eat there. The room was very small, there is no temperature control for the AC or Furnace, so we were stuck with whathever the front desk thought was ok. Another thing that we did not like was, that you have to turn in the key to your room whenever you leave the premises. (we had to do the same thing at another hotel in Paris) the owners do speak english, whichi in itself it's a mega-plus, an I mean mega-mega-mega-plus, we speak english and spanish, we could not believe the difference in treatment by Parisians, if you asked if they spoke english, the answer was most of the time, NO!, with a "I'm going to turn away now" attitude, but whenever we asked if they spoke spanish, oh, Wow! what a difference, Yes, where are you from? etc. We read the reviews about this hotel and knew that the rooms were small, etc. but still ... We had a hard time reserving the hotel, the owner wanted me to email the CC # to him. I called to make my reservation, he told me that it had to be by email or fax. nevermind the fact that an international call from the states to France it's not cheap, by any means. So I email the CC #, and Faxed the Exp. date, did not want to provide the info in one email.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for touring in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tfk31
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 8 days and 7 nights in this hotel, and staying here added to the overall experience of staying in Paris. The rooms seem small when compared to North American suites, but are perfectly average for Europe. I found the staff pleasant and helpful. I have read some reviews where the staff are described as cold or aloof, but that is likely another cultural difference - European service people are not as fawning as those in North America. I speak moderately good French and the courtesy of a " Good Morning" or "Good Evening as we entered or left assured us a perfectly courteous response. For 3 of the 4 staff, their English was far superior to my French, and they were perfectly willing to speak English once I had made an effort. It is standard in Europe to leave the key with the front desk when you leave for the day. We did it and had no issues. Use the safe if you are concerned about valuables. There was never any indication of an issue for us. We did not avail ourselves of the offered breakfast, so cannot comment on it. We will be returning to Paris in the Fall of 2012, and will return to this hotel. Clean rooms, hot water, nice staff and a Parisean ambiance with a central location and a nice view of the Eiffel Tower - all at a good price. What's not to like.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sawley00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights in June 2011, and though that it was great. The room we had overlooked the street (which is pedestrianised) but the double glazing prevented this being a problem. The room was small but had everything that we needed, including a bathroom which was recently refurbished. We had breakfast in the hotel breakfast room on the last morning we were there, and it was excellent value. There are two brasseries on either side of the street just outside the hotel, and shops and a supermarket (plus of course lots more restaurants and cafes) in the vicinity. It is about 6 minutes walk to the nearest Metro station. All in all, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Lovely Maintained Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachelandgromit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2011 after reading good reviews on here. We wanted a hotel that was near to the tower and to be honest we considered others near the Latin quarter but felt it a bit too lively for us. We were so glad we stayed here, we felt the location was perfect and at 100Euro you really won't get anything else in Paris at this value for money. Arrived into the hotel on a Saturday evening at 7:30pm and a taxi from the Eurostar (Gar du Nord) was 18Euro, but this was because we spent so long in traffic, it was very busy. We had the quickest check in ever, just gave our name and were given our keys. We felt this was a little abrupt, no friendly chitter chatter, no offer or mention of breakfast, no map, explanation of area, however this didn't really bother us too much. We had the yellow room that other people have taken pictures of. Beautiful decorated room, small but perfect and clean. I wish we would have had a view, but with arriving later on this may have been the only room available, so our view was basically the roof below, however it was nice to open the big windows in our room. It was so nice being near the tower and we were able to walk there in about 10-15 minutes and picnic at the bottom of the tower. We even went up the tower at 11pm in the evening as we were so close. Rue Cler is literally on the door of the hotel and it is convenient for fresh bread and good value for places to eat. We found a supermarket that appeared to be open literally all hours - go out of the hotel doors, turn left, then left again and at the top of the street bear left and you see it. We bought many items from here to take back to the hotel, I just wish we had a fridge but the size of the rooms would probably make it difficult. No air con in the hotel which I was aware of, however they do provide a fan. It was 27 degrees in Paris when we went and I found the fan absolutely fine, but some people may not have done. I know many people seem to have issues staying in the 7th district of Paris, but we loved it and we walked everywhere just following the river. We even managed to walk to the Gare du Bercy for our overnight train to Venice (will do a seperate review). Granted, it did take about 2 hours 30, stopping for many rest breaks and detours in between, but it was better than sitting in a taxi in a heatwave! On checking out, the lady we saw was helpful and asked if we needed a taxi and let us leave our luggage. I agree that staff can seem a little unapproachable and we did feel we were interrupting phone coversations, but it's nothing to worry about and I just think it depends on what your expectations are. Every question I asked was answered - just not over entheusiastically if that makes sense! Oh and a thank you to whoever mentioned the gypsy gold ring scam. I wouldn't have known about it otherwise and twice they attempted it. We were lucky and politely told her to go away. The second time the same gypsy lady attempted it the very next day, we told her she was a 'bad lady' and 'trick' and seemed to attract the attention of other tourists. At that point the gypsy in perfect english said 'you b!tch!' Please be aware of this.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and well located”
Reviews.Author: Heidi3030
Reviews.Content: I was staying in the hotel with my mother for five days, and we like the hotel a lot. Very centrally located literally 20 metres from several restaurants and a small shopping street, five minutes walk from a metro stop and fifteen minutes of walk from the Eiffel Tower. The staff might not be the most smiling, but they are extremely helpful. The reservation through e-mail went smoothly. And they really did the extra effort when we had problems reserving a taxi in the morning. The lady in the reception made a good deal of an effort to help us, since we had a lot of luggage to carry, and was eventually able to get us one. The rooms were cosy and clean. The only negative point is that the bed sheets are typically French, so you are lying pinned down to the bed under the carpet like in an envelope. It would be preferable if one at least could choose to have a duvet instead. When getting a room facing out to the street, be aware that it can be a bit noisy due to the restaurants outside, during night time. The breakfast is spartan and typically French and is not included in the price, so we preferred to eat at the restaurants nearby instead. No other meals than breakfast is served. Wi-Fi is free and worked very well. All in all I recommend the hotel, and wouldn´t hesitate staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and will stay again !”
Reviews.Author: AustinBill_11
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautifully furnished, and well maintained. The owners were always so helpful as we planned our daily travels: Which bus or metro to take; where to eat, etc. Location is fabulous... So close to several restaurants, shops, sights.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay for just a short amount of time”
Reviews.Author: Gtingue
Reviews.Content: As was mention from others when you walk in you see the cute dog and the owner waiting to greet you. The owner was plesant and was eager to assists me in what ever way possible. She was helpful and informative on some of the things I should look for when traveling solo in the city. ( the good and the bad) When I reached to my room it was clean and quiet, the bed was soft and inviting and the bathroom was clean and smell fresh. While the room was small it suited my needs. There are some things I feel that should be offered such and a ice machine and ice buckets so that guest will have something cold drink. The location was great walking distance to the tower, metro (train station) and there are a lot of resturant to choose from in the area. I truely enjoyed my stay at the hotel and have and continue to recommend other to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Inviting small hotel near Rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: ex_NYCerSeattle
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here. Hotel du Champ de Mars is a lovely small hotel in a great location, right off Rue Cler, and close to the Metro. Our room was small, but excellent value for the price, clean and free wi-fi. Breakfast is extra, but a good price with yummy croissants. There's no air conditioning (and we hit Paris during a heat wave), but there are fans in each room and the windows open wide. We would definitely return here on another trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “1st time in Paris LOVE LOVE LOVE the Hotel du Champ de Mars”
Reviews.Author: cristine56
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and the charming Hotel du Champ de Mars was exactly what we were hoping for. We stayed 3 nights May 29th, 30th, 31st 2011 The room was small & charming. The maid service was excellent. Everything was clean. We loved the location. We felt like we were reurning home everynight after exploring the city during the day. We visited all the major tourist sites and loved the location on the left bank. Much more relaxed area than anywhere else we visited. Walked to the Eiffel Tower which is close by, also used the Batobus (boats) located near the Eiffel Tower for exploring the rest of the city. The elevator is small. My husband used it & moved our luggage up & down, I only used the stairs. I found the ownwers and staff to be extremely friendly & eagar to help. Spoke english very well too. Arranged for a cab to the train staion on our last morning. The area is full of markets, & shops, lots of restraunnts to choose from. We hope to return one day to Paris and will definately stay here again. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but the breakfast room was very nice too. Thank you for making our first trip to Paris so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little boutique hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: wells67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night on a very quick visit to Paris with my sister. Location of hotel is awesome, just a short stroll to the Eiffel Tower and only steps from Rue Cler where you can take your pick of restaurants to eat in. Also very close to a metro station. Room was small but apparently this is quite usual for hotels in Paris and we were only there for one night and didn't spend time in the room other than to sleep anyway. Room is beautifully decorated, clean and comfortable, delightful really. Would definately stay again. NB, there is one very small lift (2 person limit) so be mindful of this if you have large bags etc. There is a stair case but it is small and spiral so wasn't any good for my sister who has a bad knee and it took ages to get the lift in the morning as it was always already full with 2 people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bargain on the Left Bank..”
Reviews.Author: starfish037
Reviews.Content: What a bargain for Paris, the location is ideal, our room was small but EXTREMELY clean and nicely decorated. Pack light because the closet in the room is small and there are no dresser drawers to put your clothes in. Also be aware the hotel does not have air conditioning. This did not bother us at all because the weather while we were in Paris was very cool.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: JeanClaudeandSophi
Reviews.Content: The location and neighborhood are awesome! Rue Cler has grocery stores, chocolate shop,gelato, cheese, meat shops, pastry shops, all kinds of restaurants and a laundromat all within walking distance. Our room was very small, but pretty. However they seriously need to address the stink in their towels. Even the clean towels are musty musty musty, The night front desk people had no answers to any of our questions and was quick to get back to his tv watching. Also no extra pillows were available. Still overall a great value and great neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and lovely French style”
Reviews.Author: JamesJS
Reviews.Content: We really loved this place and would definitely stay here again. The best part about the hotel is the location. Being in the Rue Cler area was idyllic and made us want to live in Paris! Our room was very charmingly decorated and we had a view of the Eiffel Tower! It was a very small room, but we didn't mind because we already expected that and we were barely in our room. The bathroom was small too, but nicely updated and very clean. We found the owners of the hotel to be very nice and helpful. We had breakfast in the hotel two mornings and really enjoyed the croissants! For the value and location, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly French. Great Location. Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: dr_mcgarry
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Champ de Mars was recommended by a friend, we were pleased. Here are the benefits: 1. Excellent newly renovated rooms, clean, somewhat small, but very French. 2. Excellent value for near 100 Euros per night. Fine boutique hotel. 3. The street is closed to traffic, walking only. 4. Many Cafe's, shops, bakery, grocery...it couldn't be better, it's lively. 5. The hotel is family run, friendly, excellent service. Leave your room cleaner a tip. 6. This nieghborhood is alive with the French spirit, you will have a great experience. 7. Easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and other sites. 8. Book months in advance to ensure a room. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “They Lost Our Reservation”
Reviews.Author: TravelingEms
Reviews.Content: We can't really say anything about the rooms at this hotel because we never got to see one. After several months of correspondence, and after confirming the room twice (including providing our credit card information), we arrived to the owner telling us they had no record of our 7 night reservation. Instead of acknowledging a problem, she telephoned someone and begged them (in French, which we understood) to take us. She ended up dumping us in a sub-standard room at another hotel (which we left immediately). We certainly understand that mistakes happen, but the loss of this reservation caused us to have to spend our first day in Paris scrambling to find a decent place to stay, it caused us to move hotels three times in seven days, it also caused us to lose a day in Paris because we couldn't find a room for our last day and ended up having to leave Paris and spend our last night at the airport, and it cost us over 300.00 euros because we couldn't find another hotel in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Superb Location!”
Reviews.Author: Cmaecia
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Champ de Mars was good - not particularly memorable per say but it was good value for the price. The rooms were cute but the space is definitely on the smaller side. The location on the other hand was superb, right in the Rue Cler neighborhood, a couple feet from bustling cafes like the Cafe du Marche, great patisseries, and not a bad walk to the Ecole Militaire metro stop. Rue Cler was definitely an ideal location to stay in and I always felt safe walking around during late hours (thanks Rick Steves). You can tell the staff is familiar with North Americans - it seems that all the guests that stay there are either from the US or Canada. Staff can get snappy at times but it didn't bother me at all. Most of the interactions with the staff were perfectly fine to me - we purchased the Paris Museum Pass with them as well as a Paris Orly Airport transfer and everything went smoothly. I would definitely stay here again although I should add that it would be great if a mini refrigerator was available in all the rooms but given the cramped space already, that would be unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely True Paris”
Reviews.Author: SouthCounty
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience the true Paris environment, this is your hotel. The location is absolutely wonderful. It is located within walking distance of many Paris attractions. The "neighborhood" is truly great with sidewalk cafes everywhere, bakeries (as only the French can pull off) close by and an assortment of other shops, ice cream parlors etc. within immediate reach. The hotel itself is small and the rooms are not spacious but again, if you want the true Paris experience, this boutique hotel will deliver and then some. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly regardless of some of the reviews. Breakfast (8 Euros) is a bargain and starts your day with the typical French cuisine, pasteries, fruit, yogurt, juice and great coffee. And by the way, the rooms, the dining area, basically the whole hotel is spotlessly clean. Without a doubt, and I have been to Paris three times, this hotel, even though it is my first visit to Hotel Champ De Mars, will be where I will stay from now on. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to feel like you are truly in Paris. Why else would you go??

Reviews.Title: “Simple, quaint, easy”
Reviews.Author: mpg71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent four nights here. Our room, while simple, was clean, comfortable, and a decent size. The bathroom was large enough for two people to maneuver. The price was reasonable and the staff was efficient and mostly friendly. The reason I give an above average mark is due to its location. Rue Cler is a quiet, safe, charming neighborhood. Within a block of the hotel is a bakery, a cheese shop, a meat shop, great crepes, and good restaurants. There's a metro stop within two blocks and the Eiffel Tower and a few other sites are a short walk. It's not a lavish hotel, but for a short stay in Paris, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: klafrow1
Reviews.Content: The best feature of this hotel is the excellent location. Very convenient to restaurants, shopping and the metro. I had a 'double room', which was the smallest room I have had in Paris. I travel yearly to Paris and other cities in Europe, so I am used to small rooms. I can't imagine two people in this room, there would be absolutely no space for a second suitcase (as it was, mine blocked the door). It was also next to the check-in area, which was a little noisy. I would not stay again, but rather explore other areas of the city. This is a great hotel for a first time visitor, as long as one is not expecting large American style hotel rooms. Staff were very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This is a charming & quant french hotel in an AMAZING and lively neighborhood! Great hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: vmcleod
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and quant in the heart of Paris' district 7. The rooms and waterclosets are very small from an American perspective, but very clean, modern, and nice decor. Elevator was obviously added later, it is small and only fits two. If you plan to spend a lot of time sitting you your room, this isn't the place for you. If you plan on experiencing the city and enjoying all Paris has to offer....you will LOVE this little hotel's location! It is just steps away from Rue Cler, which is often referred to as the "best street in Paris". Rue Cler is a pedistrian street filled with small markets, fromages (cheese), boulangerie(bakery), and delicious side-walk cafes. It is only a few walking blocks from the Eiffel Tower and other popular tourist sites. It has a laundromat (so you can pack light), several banks (for ATMs), and a post-office less than a block away. It is very close to the Ecole Militaire Metro station and also a Velib public bike station. Visible from the front step of this hotel is a Velib station with over 50 bikes! Locals and tourists use these bikes as an excellent quick way to get from location to location. Paris is a very flat city so biking isn't strenuous. It is an amazing way to get familiar with the city and enjoy the spring weather! This is a great little hotel that offers a phenominal location. Close to so many things to do and see. And close to all the necessities a traveler would need!

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: BellsTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed eight nights at this hotel on our first trip to Paris, and we loved it! First, it offers extreme value in a very expensive city, and yet you don't feel like you are sacrificing anything for it. The rooms are tiny but beautiful, and are very well appointed. The beds very comfortable especially for European standards. Everything was very clean, and maid service was very thorough. We had a room with a bath which we requested, and there was excellent water pressure and lots of hot water. We had breakfast almost everyday there. It was delicious. The absolute best baguettes on our trip! There are a few ways you could do breakfast there a little cheaper, but for the extra euro or two it was so nice to have it delivered to your room or eat in the adorable breakfast room. The only negative we could find was the lack of air-conditioning especially since we had a room overlooking the street. The neighborhood is very calm, BUT there are two very noisy cafes on the corner of the block, and the french eat very late! But we downloaded a white noise album, and connected it to our speakers, and that took care of that. If you are a light sleeper I would request a room that isn't on the street side. That is what we intend to do when we come back with extended family. Internet wi-fi worked great! Never had a problem with it. The neighborhood is a delight. Rue Cler has to be on of the cutest streets on Paris. Don't miss the Sunday market. It's great for assembling the best gourmet picnic! We also found the area very centrally located. Just a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel, and a short metro ride to other key areas. The area also seemed to escape the hordes of tourists that were in Paris (we were there for Easter weekend and were taken aback the crowds!). All in all I would not hesitate to stay at this little gem of a hotel. Just keep in mind that there is no air if you plan a trip in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room with great view in great location”
Reviews.Author: burnsey223
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and the bed was comfortable. We were on the 4th floor and had a great view of the Eiffel tower. I like the small, 2 person, elevator but it would be claustrophobic to some. No free breakfast. We were at the corner of the Rue Cler which is a less touristy part of Paris and close to the tower. The service of the staff was good as expected however, they were not overly friendly as compared to other hotel staff in other counties we stayed at during our tour of Europe. They didn't interact with us much, such as recommending places to eat at or visit. The staff did say we could leave our backpacks there the day of checkout when we asked.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Terrible, Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: BOSCO26
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel four nights as first stop on a 3 week vacation in Europe. Don't be fooled by the pictures. Most of the rooms are extremely small and the beds hard as a board, comparable to sleeping on the floor in a small closet. We were so disappointed and uncomfortable that we requested a different room not matter what the charge. We also requested and begged for extra pillows. The lady at the front desk agreed to grant our request several times but then refused to change our room, despite us witnessing as rooms became available, and never followed through with the pillows. At one point she suggested that we find another hotel but only gave us 15 minutes to do so. We have stayed in other hotels in Europe and other continents, and we understand that rooms in Europe tend to be small, especially for relatively low-priced accommodations, but we have never had such bad service and such uncomfortable experience. The only good thing about it is definitely the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very cosy”
Reviews.Author: ladybird340
Reviews.Content: This place is excellent, quality price and within walking distance of metro station Ecole militaire. The receptionist was nice and professional. My single room was very cosy, some noise of the elevator next to my room. It would be nice if travellers leaving the hotel at 6 am would be less noisy in the corridors for those who are sleeping...

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, Clean, Quiet”
Reviews.Author: 55rdss
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights and the place was perfect. The room was clean, and was perfect for the 2 of us. We did not hang out much in the room, as we were in Paris to see Paris. Would definately stay here again. Staff was nice and helpful, but we are not high maintenance people. Very convienient with grocery next door, laundry a block away, excellent restaurant down the road, and all the open air markets and shops on Rue Cler. Easy walk to Metro stop, also Eiffle Towel, Rodin Museum, and Napoleon's tomb/Military Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: expatwinemaker
Reviews.Content: Great hotel well situated in good area near metro station. Helpful and friendly reception.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: SCRuth
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by Rick Steve's Paris book. It was quiet, comfortable and convenient for tourists. Wifi worked well, staff was courteous. The only recommendation I would make is to RESPOND to emails directly and as helpfully as possible especially during the booking process. This was true for all of the hotels I contacted both last year and this year, not just this one.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thebay43
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights and loved the place. Not the spot to entertain as the rooms are livable but small. The location is perfect next to Rue Clair which, if you haven't been to Paris is everything you thought Paris was! Glace (ice cream shops, wine, groceries, bakery, small cafes for perfect coffee and pastries (Starbucks eat your heart out). The view from our room was onto the Rue Champ de Mars which looks like every french film ever seen. Enjoyed our hosts, don't let them fool you, they are sweethearts so is their puppy. We will come bake to this perfect small hotel and recommend it to all our friends. Tony & Elizabeth, Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and charming rooms”
Reviews.Author: Paris124
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. If you are looking for a well-located, charming, two-star hotel for a very reasonable price, this is a great choice for you: Its location is only a short walk from the Ecole Militaire metro stop, a couple of small grocery stores and a Carrefour, and also right by the Rue Cler market street! (Also, if you must, as we did (on day 4), a Starbucks is a few blocks away- go a couple blocks north on Rue Cler, to Rue St Dominique- turn right-on the same street in the opposite direction are three well-known restaurants, Les Cocottes, Cafe Constant, and Le Violon D'Ingres.) This hotel is in a very nice residential area and Rue Cler is frequented by the locals. Charm- just look at the photos others have posted, and another plus- the rooms have very good comfortable beds, too. The price can't be beat in the lovely 7e area. Two more comments: this is a small hotel, with only about 25 rooms. You probably need to book several months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Niels2
Reviews.Content: Stayed between 14 and 17 March. The hotel is located about 600 m from the Eifell Tower, thus smack in the center of the most popular attractions in Paris. The Metro Ecole Militaire is a two minute walk so it is possible to access all areas of Paris via the Metro if needed. The area is safe and charming. Lots of restaurants, shops and even a supermarket next door the hotel. Although the hotel and room is small (especially the elevator!), it is clean and indeed very charming. Great place to stay - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: clalves
Reviews.Content: Owners and staff very sweet. Hotel clean, parisian breakfast very good. I have stayed here 4 different times in the last 5 years. I always feel like I've come home when I walk in the door, and sadden when I leave. I have brought family and friends here and now they will only come here for their stay in Paris. I love booking their reservations and knowing I'm sending them to such a wonderful place and they will be well taken care of. The location is great for attractions and around the corner is the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Clean! Great location. Quaint”
Reviews.Author: boomertee
Reviews.Content: We r from Chicago. First time in Paris. This hotel has a great location . Shops. Cafes. Restaurants. Walk to Eiffel Tower. $9 euros to the Louvre. Bathrooms are new modern and spotless. Bed is great linens are top quality. Room decor is done well. We walkec for blocks and blocks all night. People out and about. The owner cares a lot about her hotel and has a passion for it. The safe needs to be upgraded..it is too small and won't fit an ipad. We will stay here again! Clean hotel! Our room was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great bargain in wonderful rue Cler”
Reviews.Author: righteousbabe73
Reviews.Content: This is a nice bargain choice in a good area. Lots of cafes, vendors and pastry shops at your doorstep. Loved all the flower shops that lined the street. The Eiffel Tower and other major sites are within easy walking distance and there is a metro stop close by. The hotel lobby and rooms are very, very small but this is not unusual for Paris. My friend and I stayed in a room with two twin beds pushed together and there was not much room to maneuver about. So, if you need a lot of personal space this is probably not a good choice. You can feel confined at points, but the room is comfortable and you can always venture out into the neighborhood if you need to escape. If you are in Paris for leisure, you probably won't be spending much time in the room anyway. The bathroom also is very tiny but has hot water with a lot of pressure. Our room was unbearably hot, but we figured out how to control the heat and it was all good after that. However, be warned the hotel does not have air conditioning so I would not recommend it for summer stays. For 100 Euros a night, this place is a great bargain. Rooms, while not fancy or large, are clean and the front desk staff is pleasant. The hotel also has free WiFi. I would stay here on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic jewel of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Christine C
Reviews.Content: We whittled down our list to a couple of Rick Steves' choices, but the positive tripadvisor reviews put Hotel du Champ de Mars to the top position. What a winner! I had stayed in the rue Cler neighborhood years ago and it was a real pleasure to return to this lovely, cozy area, full of mom-n-pop fromageries, boulangeries, charcuteries, patisseries, and just a few steps from the L'Ecole Militaire metro stop. You also have your own full-service post office around the corner, and goodness knows, there are two ATMs on every block. We arrived from our transatlantic flight too early in the morning to check into our room, so the mgmt allowed us to hold our luggage (right there in the precious lobby,) while we started our city wandering. Upon our return several hours later, not only was the room ready but our bags had already been moved to it for us! We had a totally cozy and comfortable gem of a room on the ground floor with a private postage-stamp sized courtyard, it was perfect. Excellent wi fi reception, which was critical for uploading each day's photos at each day's end. Arguably, the best water pressure either of us had ever received in a hotel shower, that's for sure. CNN is the only English-language tv channel, but we only had it on in the background at night so that was a very minor minus, indeed. There is breakfast served in a downstairs dining room but for an extra 8EUR pp, so we passed and easily made our daily choices for much less at a few of "our" bakeries and cafes on our walks btwn the hotel and the metro stop around the corner, no problem. Next trip to Paris, I wouldn't hesitate at all to stay here again. The owners were very personable and helpful and took an interest in our every comfort and enjoyment, of both their inn and their city.

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel you should stay it !”
Reviews.Author: Gregstar1971
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. When I return to Paris I will stay here again. The hotel is accurately priced and it is in a nice, quiet little street. It is a short walk from École Militaire metro station and has plenty of supermarkets in walking distance. The best one is Carrefour near the metro. There are markets on some evenings in nearby streets with excellent food and it is close to some great pâtisseries. The owners are gorgeous ! Very friendly and they have a cute, old cocker spaniel named Cannelle. The owners helped out with travel advice too ! A lap top with wi-fi can be borrowed for free as well, which is really handy for travellers like myself who do not want to lug one around. I miss it already. Stay there, you won't be disappointed !

Reviews.Title: “A spectacular bargain...”
Reviews.Author: whitingbay
Reviews.Content: When my usual hotel in the 7e, Hotel Thoumieux, put its prices up by a crazy amount, I had to look for an alternative. Hotel Champ du Mars was a great find: good prices, a lovely room with an efficient shower, and with very pleasant and polite staff. Spend the extra and have breakfast there - it's excellent and much cheaper than trying to find a bar / cafe locally. We will certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Neighborhood Gem with Endless Charm”
Reviews.Author: RyanE1111
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I traveled to Paris for a quick Valentine's Day weekend together, and could not have been happier with our hotel choice. Just off bustling Rue Cler, the location was a huge selling point for us. Hotel du Champ de Mars is positioned right in between the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides, and is less than a 10 minute walk to each. But, our favorite part about the location was that Rue Cler was right outside the front door. An extremely charming pedestrian street with open-air markets, restaurants, and shops - there's always something happening. We were a little unsure about finding a place to eat late on Saturday night (11pm), but there were still a number of options right around the corner, and we still felt safe walking around the area after 2am.
