It had a great neighborhood feel. The room we stayed in (#2) was small, but very clean and well kept. We even had a little courtyard entry to the room, which made it quiet and private, as if we were staying in our own separate bungalow. We didn't see a single other person while we were there that did not work at the hotel. Definitely a huge bonus for a quaint and romantic weekend! The bed was comfortable, the bath/shower had plenty of hot water and pressure, and there was even a television in the top corner of the room with CNN in english. The owners of the hotel were extremely nice, helpful, and unassuming. They have the front desk staffed 24 hrs/day due to the fact that when you leave the hotel you need to leave your room key with them. This turned out to be sort of an unexpected surprise for me, as you didn't have to worry about losing your key, and there was always someone available to help with anything you need. Apart from the owners, there were two other gentlemen who helped cover the night shift at the desk, and all spoke english pretty well. At the front desk, were able to buy museum passes, print Eiffel Tower tickets, as well as arrange an airport shuttle. There was a small miscommunication issue with the shuttle due to the fact that is was going between two of the desk attendants and we weren't completely sure they had it scheduled for pick-up, but it ended up working out in the end. Highly recommend Hotel du Champ de Mars - amazing value, charming neighborhood feel, and adorable by design.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: bouncingbunny
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Hotel du Champs de Mars because we love it! The location is superior ~ a few steps away from rue Cler which is filled with marvelous little shops, eateries, etc. Some of Zagat's finest restaurants are also within a few walking blocks from the hotel ~ Christian Constant has several on rue Saint-Dominique; Le Florimond (located on av. de la Motte-Picquet) is even closer to the hotel. Rooms are tiny (this is Paris after all), but beautifully decorated. Rooms also have either a closet or armoire to store luggage and clothing. Our room, #45, had an abbreviated view of the Eiffel Tower. We were also told that our bathroom was going to be renovated after we checked out on February 3. We thought the bathroom was in beautiful condition, so it is apparent that the owners take great pride in maintaining their facility. FYI ~ this hotel does have an elevator. An important feature for many travelers. Don't hesitate in making a decision to stay in this charming little Parisian hotel. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a wonderful locations!”
Reviews.Author: LD2010
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel du Champ de Mars through TA, and whilst my initial communication with them was slow & a bit unnerving, it was a FANTASTIC little hotel almost hidden out of the way. Yes, the rooms are small, but they are clean & comfortable which is the main thing. The front desk staff were very pleasant & happy to help answer any questions. The location is ideal, in the 7e just off a quiet pedestrian market street with lots of little delis, butchers, patisseries and restaurants. The hotel was approximately a 10min walk to the Eiffel Tower (If you walk the right way!), 5 mins ish to the Hotel Des Invalides & Ecole Militaire, 20 mins walk to the bottom end of the Champs Elysees / Louvre. The only little things that weren’t so good was that the room was so hot, even after a long day out sightseeing in winter, the room was very stuffy & hot, so much so that we left the window ajar during the night just to get some cooler air in (even though it was only 3-5 degrees when we stayed). Also, there wasn’t a mini bar fridge in the room, so we were unable to make use of the cheese & wine shops on Rue Cler and with the room so warm anything would have gone yucky very quickly! But having said that, at 100 euros per night, you can’t complain with what you do get. We didn’t eat breakfast at the hotel during our stay, instead opting 2 mornings to go to cafes, then for the remainder of our stay bought our croissants and pain au chocolat at the patisserie on the corner & brought it back to our room to eat. I would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel if you are looking for somewhere central, yet sticking to a reasonable budget.

Reviews.Title: “good location and value”
Reviews.Author: mixtli
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this hotel, at the beginning and at the end of our trip. It's not easy to find affordable hotels in Paris and I think this is a good choice if you don't want to spend too much money. It's a basic hotel, very close to a nice area of restaurants and shops and about 1 block from a subway station. It took us about 40 minutes to get to the hotel by taxi from Orly. We didn't try the breakfast as there are some options around. The room was nicely decorated and according to the price, not big but comfortable enough for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Paris”
Reviews.Author: RoamingJetPilot
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Champ de Mars for the last three years while in Paris promoting the children's summer camp that I co-own with my brothers. It is a very cute hotel with rooms that may be small but are beautiful and funcional. The staff could not be more helpful, and friendly. The owners Françoise and Stéphane make you really feel like they are glad you are staying with them. The location is fantastic. Rue Clair is a great area with lots of good restaurants. It is about two blocks from the Eco Militaire metro stop. An example of how honest this hotel is, I left a whole bunch of credit cards in the room safe last year (guess I was in a rush to get to the airport), and they found them, emailed me, and mailed them back to the USA for me. Because I knew this hotel so well, I did not bother to cancel any of the cards, and none of them we ever used. Thank you! Carter

Reviews.Title: “Good room, good location !”
Reviews.Author: Hongkonger10739
Reviews.Content: We are from HK and lived at X'mas time. We would like to express our thanks to one bright staff, SLYN who did help us a lot during the stay. The room are cosy and nice. Clean bedsheet and tidy bathroom. We did have a good time here!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in an excellent location with great owners”
Reviews.Author: revdrdave
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a lovely, quaint lodging with bi-lingual owners and desk help. The location is wonderful, for example, an easy fifteen minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and close to the Metro. Many lovely shops, restaurants and grocery stories right around the corner. The room are smaller but nice. Beds are excellent. In light of Paris prices, Champ de Mars is an excellent value, but it is wise to reserve well in advance. They even offer a continental breakfast for eight euros, but suggest that one would do better at one of the many restaurants nearby for about the same price and would also include Canadian bacon and egg in addition. Use Paris Shuttle as recommended by the owners.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: KristieJones
Reviews.Content: Stephanie and Francoise were wonderful hosts and made us feel welcome during our 2 week stay with them. Our room was decorated well and the cleaning staff was super. It is an easy place to travel to and from with the Metro stop nearby. Breakfast for 8 euro was filling and served in a quaint dining room downstairs or it can be sent to your room. Stephanie has decorated the hotel for the Christmas season and it is beautiful and has a warm atmosphere. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service - Horrible attitdues!”
Reviews.Author: Seth080
Reviews.Content: While the location, and the facility is very nice, the managment, and the people that they have hired to help them run the hotel are completely awful. This goes beyond rude just downright terrible. I wouldn't judge France by these folks, they give the French a bad name. I truly would recommend to any travelers looking into this hotel, to pick another close by. Rue Cler is magical, this hotel is not.

Reviews.Title: “Best location to see points of interest,nice ambience ,great place!!”
Reviews.Author: shelley052
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in Sept. and it has really good staff and very helpful and always asked if we needed anything!We stayed on the fifth floor and there is a small elevator to use but we used the stairs all the time,and the room was great and very clean and we left the windows open so that we could hear the sound of Paris in our room for abit, it was great and in the morning would look out at the street below and just watch the people doing their daily routine.It was very central to the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre, the Musay du Orsay, the Arc du Triumph, and Champ Elise, we walked to every one of those (some were a fair hike) but best way to see that part of Paris, I would stay here again in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “High quality accommodations. Would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Rose32655
Reviews.Content: We were there recently for 10 nights. The room was spacious and clean. The bed was extremely comfortable. In mid-November, the weather was quite chilly but the room temperature was warm and toasty. Owners, Francoise and Stephane, are on site almost all day every day, and run a tight ship. The hotel's public spaces appear well maintained. We were impressed, particularly given the reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: cdngrl6
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel was recommended by a family friend and it absolutely hit the mark. For 98 euros the rooms were clean and although small were manageable for 2 people. The location is excellent being just a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and just steps away from Rue de Clerc. There are many great cafes in the area and the hotel is just a couple of doors down from a grocery store. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only critique I would have is the breakfast. We tried it one morning and it was not worth 8 euros. I wouold recommend the local patissieries or cafes where you get much more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, location and an exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: stcroixwriter
Reviews.Content: This little gem was ideal for our six night vacation - a short walk to the Eiffel Tower or Invalides,with a Metro station 5 minutes away and a bevy of food options at all price ranges very close at hand. We bought roses for our room,plus cheeses, bread and inexpensive French wines around the corner at Rue Cler for stay-in evenings. We made good use of the post office and user-friendly laundromat each just a block away. Our room #12 was quite compact but cheerful with yellow fabrics and it served us well - there is a phone-booth size elevator but we often used the stairs since we were just one flight from the lobby and two flights above the breakfast room. We took breakfast at the hotel most mornings - at 8 Euros, it was a fine value with a pot of coffee for each of us, excellent fresh croissants with butter and jams, baguettes, Camembert cheese wedge, lemon cake, yoghurt and fruit cocktail all included daily and served as soon as we arrived in the attractive breakfast room. The time saved got us out and about quickly each morning, and we never used the in-room breakfast option. The owners and other staff were very helpful and pleasant, and made a loaner laptop available for free Wi-Fi in the room, very convenient and a money saver. We enjoyed chatting in bits of French and mostly English with the owner and his wife about our late and greatly-missed dog - their cocker Cannelle (means Cinnamon in French) was often there to great us in the lobby with a tail wag. We loved our stay and would return without hesitation - in fact will add a Paris stop to future trips whether we need to or not!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a hearth of gold”
Reviews.Author: georgesaguna
Reviews.Content: This might be small two star hotel but it has a heart of gold. It's a family run hotel and all the personnel that do attend to it have pride in what they do to keep it looking spotless and cosy for all those residing in it. All the reception staff speak French and English and they are more then helpful at any time of the day. We have been to this hotel three times in the past three years and the standard has always been top notch. The place is so central that on our first visit I couldn’t believe our luck. It’s situated between the Eiffel tower and the Les Invalides and a two minute walk from the Ecole Militaire metro station. There are a number or amazing restaurants around the corner from the hotel, all situated in a pedestrianized road. What I also loved was that there was a dry cleaning shop and a supermarket just beside (which is so handy with small kids ). The only two I did't like (as I do need to loose weight) was that there was a lovely, amazingly stocked cheese shop and an outstanding patisserie which caused me to get out of the hotel to try some thing new every day. You can’t be much more central then that. I also will never forget the fist time we walked into our room, I just drew the curtains apart and just there in front of us, as an added bonus to our luck, we could see the sparkling Eiffel tower. I think I shouldn't be writhing this review as I do consider the place to be a hidden gem, a place I wish to return to and find a room at every time.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian character in a great location”
Reviews.Author: paulamac
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on rue Chap du Mars within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. Ecole Militare was the closest subway and bus stop. We were able to walk to the Louver, Champ Elysses, Arc de Triomphe and d'Orsay. There were lots of cafes, shops, fruit and vegetable stands and a laundry nearby. The room and bathroom were small and charming. We had breakfast there every morning for 8 euro each and felt it was worth it. The hotel is kept very clean. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in great area”
Reviews.Author: jba064
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value with helpful staff and clean rooms. The location is in a centrally located safe area for women. The hotel even has a lap top for guests to use.

Reviews.Title: “NICE PLACE TO STAY AND AWAYFROM TRFFIC”
Reviews.Author: watraveler009
Reviews.Content: This a very nice, well managed, small hotel only steps away from rue Cler, 15 minute walk to the Eiffel tower and other attractions. It's like living in a small neighborhood. On rue Cler you can purchase fresh cut flowers for your room. a good bottle of wine, a wide variety of cheeses, any kind of bread you can dream of, fresh strawberries and other fruits, chocolate at the chocolate shop. There is a shop where you can buy tablecloths, etc. which are beautifully made - in France! There are a number of very nice eateries - and one very bad one - If you are fortunate you won't discover it! Just look at the place which has the fewest customers - at any time of the day. I recommend this hotel to any and all who are looking for a great place, in the french tradition and not just another big, expensive hotel where you may as well be in Chicago! We stayed three weeks - and I would go back tomorrow! It's that good!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful location, we could walk every where.”
Reviews.Author: Judy4530
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was the best choice we could have made in planning our trip to Paris. Friends had stayed at Champ du Mars, and recommended it . The location was great,so easy to get around. We didn't have to go far to wonderful restraunts and cafes We would certainly return .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience with View of Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: RamonaRocks
Reviews.Content: Hotel Du Champ de Mars is in a wonderful location in Rue Cler with lots of cafes & shops. Our room was very comfortable and had a view of the Eiffel Tower. It was also surprisingly quiet since the neighborhood has lots of activity. It is a great place to walk around with limited traffic. The staff at the hotel is very friendly and we would definitely go back and recommend this hotel if you want to have a great experience in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable with a perfect location and offering great value”
Reviews.Author: paris155019
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Champ de Mars for five nights in October 2010 and were delighted with it. We have travelled in Europe many times, and know not to expect the large rooms and all the extra amenities that we take for granted on the North American scene. Our hotel room was charmingly decorated, the hotel in such a perfect location, and the price so reasonable, that we were able to spend our time (and saved money) seeing all the great sites and eating all the great food that Paris has to offer. We would stay there again in a heartbeat, and would have no trouble recommending this hotel to any of our friends, who, like us, travel to Europe for the wonderful experiences and not for a North American style hotel room to lounge around in. We found the owners to be very helpful (husband and wife team) but did find fault with one staff member on the desk one evening who did not seem to wish to be bothered by the clients. All the other staff were fine. We discovered this hotel via Rick Steves' France.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: daytripperJ
Reviews.Content: It's hard for me to imagine what people went through to right a poor review of this cute little hotel, but I guess, sometimes, you DO have a bad experience. I can't say we did,....we had a GREAT time. Francois and Stephane are very polite, and helpful (those who say they aren't, stumps me). Many times, Francois went to the map to show us where to go, and what RER, Metro, or bus line, so in our experience, very nice! People, the building was built in 1864, ...you can't expect TOO much. Our room (15) was comfy, clean and we slept well. And, ...the street wasn't too noisy, as a matter of fact, we slept with the window cracked most nights. The din from Cafe du Marche could be heard from our room, which, was kind of neat to hear. Francois told us the street side rooms are a little noisy, but we preferred the larger rooms, which, are street-side, by the way ;) Just blocks from the Eiffel Tour, this Rue Cler area hotel is a great location. Wandering around Rue Cler, Rue Grenelle, and Rue de St. Domonique is a great afternoon! Especially on Saturday when Rue Cler is just BUSTLING with people and the markets and the awesome 3 piece band that strolls the street from 9am till early afternoon. Rue Cler on Saturday morning is a picture-takers-paradise for Parisian life!!! We WILL DEFINITELY be back, and maybe stay in room 1 or 2 in the courtyard next time! Until then, thanks for the memories (my first time in Paris) .... Au Revoir!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: milliann
Reviews.Content: This is a small family run hotel which is in a great location near the Eiffell Tower. The owners are very friendly and the room was small but very comfortable. Breakfast was adequate -8 euro. We would stay here again if we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: leblancchaz
Reviews.Content: We are so happy we stayed at this Hotel, great room, staff, excellent price & location. Close to metro and great restaurants. We especially loved eating at " Au Petit Cler ". Walked to the Eiffel Tower . Would definitly stay there again. Charlotte & Jacqueline

Reviews.Title: “A nice small Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lazydaze1050
Reviews.Content: This hotel is typical of small Paris hotels: some very small rooms, not.a lot of amenities but a comfortable place to sleep. Ask for the 41, 51, etc.rooms..best in the hotel. The best part is it's location. The Rue Cler neighborhood is one of the best in Paris. If you want the true flavor of Paris this is the place to stay. Lots of cages, stores, etc. Within Easy walking distance. Good rest. Recommendations from owner. Easy walk to Eiffel Tower area. Metro entrance close by. A nice little gem in the. Center of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, local neighborhood, clean and friendly staff make it a great value”
Reviews.Author: mfeltz
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to stay in an area with a "neighborhood feel" where locals shop in the morning on a pedestrian street with vendors lining both sides of the street, this hotel is a great choice. While not a luxury stay, it has everything you need and puts you close to the Eifell Tower and a main Metro line. The breakfast is included with stay and while standard in what is offered, the quality of the croissants etc are great. We love this neighborhood as the restaurants and shops are much less touristy than Saint Germaine and farther upriver near the Louvre. The room we stayed in was a bit small, but was very inexpensive per night so we did not mind. Overall, this is a great location, clean and great value hotel. Especially for a second visit to Paris where you want a different view than the main tourist centers, you cannot beat the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “No frills but good value”
Reviews.Author: L A
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with good service. Rooms are small and minimal -- not a place to hang out for hours watching tv or playing with children -- but great if you're intending to be out and about most of the time. The price is very reasonable, the location terrific. Service to and from the airport is easy to arrange, and much less costly than a taxi. Be sure to reserve at the desk in plenty of time for this service, it is worth it. Enjoy the great walks in this neighbourhood! Caution! Wireless internet is only in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Dachidog
Reviews.Content: The owners made our trip so much better by giving us information about where to find little-known places (example: where to find the best fabric stores). They even lent us their computer. The rooms are average size, but homey. The location is excellent. I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - if you like no aircon and a bed that dips”
Reviews.Author: ChelseyPerth
Reviews.Content: We had no problems checking in, its a cute room, enough space for a Paris hotel with a little fan should you get hot. It was piping hot the week we were there, so the fan did little but blow hot air around. We found the staff to be fine, not overly welcoming, but definately not rude either, they just do their job. The position is really good, lots of restaurants around, great bakeries, macaroon & cheese shops, plus a supermarket 10 metres away which is handy, although there is no fridge in the room, so if you buy drinks.. well, I'm sure you get the picture. The main downfall to the room is the bed. Its a small queen, that really dips in the centre, so not that comfortable, but for 98 euro a night, its pretty good, considering you could pay 3 times the price else where and still have the same probs!

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel in the Rue Cler Area”
Reviews.Author: Orv39
Reviews.Content: If and when I travel to Paris again, this is the hotel for me!! The owners, Francoise and Stephane, along with their loveable dog Cinnamon, really made my daughter and me feel welcome. Their knowledgeable staff also assisted us in saving so much time, as this was our first trip to Paris. The rooms were clean, and the hotel even had a little elevator. The only disadvantage maybe, that the hotel is not air conditioned, so if it is hot in Paris, that maybe an issue for some folks. Luckilly, when we were there at the end of July 2010, the weather was glorious. The area also cannot be beat. Be sure to try a crepe fro Ulysses down the street, or a fine Italian meal at La Taverna a couple of blocks away. The hotel even has wireless internet available, so planning our time was easy. The room also had a safe which was easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: euromerp
Reviews.Content: This was my third time staying at the Champ de Mars. When I was in Paris last year, I wasn't able to get in, and after returning this year, I realized just how much I missed it. For the price and location, this place cannot be beat. My room was a single of the fifth floor. It was small but in a comfy cozy rather than claustrophobic way. The bathroom was newly updated and the bed was surprisingly firm and comfortable. During most of my time, Francoise (one of the owners) was at the front desk and she was just lovely. Always a "bonjour, enjoy your day", any questions were answered happily, we even had some nice conversations. In this neighborhood and for this price, the Champ de Mars really cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money, would happily stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Feisty03
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Champ de Mars has charming and comfortable if rather small rooms, within a ten minute walk of the Eiffel tower.We had heavy suitcases so we were very grateful for the elevator! We found the rates very reasonable given the good location.The area surrounding the hotel is a safe and interesting place to walk, with lots of cafes, market stalls and shops to explore. The continental breakfast was generous, the owner Francoise was most attentive and helpful and anxious to do anything that would ensure that we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Would stay there again."”
Reviews.Author: bruce76lorraine
Reviews.Content: We went there with my brother-in-law and his wife. This is their third time in Paris and staying at Hotel Du Champ De Mars. Their description of the hotel lived up to our expectations. Very friendly owners. Felt very secure in the hotel - which is situated in the lovely Rue Clare neighborhood. Within walking distance to many attractions and also very close to the subway - which was so efficient. The U. S. could learn a thing or two from the French!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: yoslug
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for 5 nights a few weeks ago - it was fabulous! The hotel is in a residential section which was great because we did not go to Paris to be surrounded by Americans and other tourists. The hotel is adjacent to Rue Cler which is a street with markets & quaint French cafes. We would get a croissant or crepe for breakfast, have lunch while out in the city, and return to have a glass of wine (or 2!) at one of the cafes near the hotel. And do some serious people watching. We would then have dinner at a nearby cafe. I even got my hair cut & styled at a local coiffure around the corner. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the metro & a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower. The front desk was very helpful - we went to Bruges for the day & needed help confirming that trip with the local contact & they handled that for us. They also had a laptop that guests could borrow to check local news, etc. We didn't eat breakfast downstairs (ate out every day) so I can't comment on that. Another thing - there is a grocery store right next store which was great - we bought wine & snacks to have in the room as needed. (and Belgium beer!) Yes, the rooms are small compared to American hotel rooms but this is Paris. If you want a real Parisian experience, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but serviceable”
Reviews.Author: AlbertMcMahon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Champ de Mars for 4 nights in Paris and thoroughly enjoyed the location. The room was very small but at 98 euros per night, we understand it was a good price for Paris. This did not include breakfast or air conditioning. But that was fine because we loved walking along the Rue Cler and buying the French pastries (they were absolutely delicious!), along with some fresh fruit and yogurt from one of the little markets and then topping it all off with a café au lait from one of the local cafes or small restaurants. Tres bien!! We found the hotel adequate although, on our last night there, the receptionist told us we would have to move to accommodate a family who all wanted to be on the same floor. We resisted this suggestion as we had booked this hotel way back in May and there was no mention about moving to a different room at that time. We had our printed e-mails and confirmation with us so in the end, we didn’t have to move. I would strongly advise all travelers to have their correspondence by e-mail printed out and carried with them when travelling anywhere….saves time and misunderstandings! All in all, we loved the location of this hotel, just 2 blocks away from the Eiffel tower but the management seemed a tad cool and unapproachable. No matter, we enjoyed our stay in Paris and would probably try to find a hotel with air conditioning next time, although we know the price would go up substantially! Bon voyage to all those travelling to Paris and get ready for the best food in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, cute rooms, incredible value”
Reviews.Author: lindalu26
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The traditional french decor was a joy. The rooms are very small, but they are cute and comfortable. Airconditioning is non-existent. This was not a problem for us, but may not be so pleasant when the temperatures mount. The mattresses were comfortable and the rooms clean. The corridors are in need of new carpeting, but easy to overlook given the quality of the rooms we had. Leave your door and you are on rue Cler which boast wonderful traditional style french bistros, fruit stands, bakeries and wine shops. Incredible value at 100Euros. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “darling paris charm”
Reviews.Author: cmr47006
Reviews.Content: Loved this little hotel with its darling Paris charm. It was sweetly and tastefully decorated, clean, good mattresses, and the owners were extremely helpful and personable. It was a great deal for the the location too. Close to the Eiffel tower and great little cafes across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Staff,”
Reviews.Author: hnllaw
Reviews.Content: I have to say out of all the stops we made on our honeymoon, this was by far the worst. I was really looking forward to this portion of our trip, and left feeling like I never want to go back. Paris was beautiful, Hotel du Champ de Mars made it forgettable. The staff WILL STEAL from you. We witnessed it first hand and were also victims of it. The front desk person leaves at night and takes the keys (you have to give them your room key when you leave) and basically goes shopping. I couldn't believe the reaction I got when I confronted the manager in the morning (who said he was the owner too). He was totally dismissive and then gives my some ridiculous french metaphor and then says "if I don't like it then too bad" - literally what he said. Mind you, I was not asking for anything, all I went there to say is what we saw that night and then what we found missing, and for that I guess "if I don't like it then too bad". DO NOT STAY HERE if you want to keep your things. From arriving and not being greeted (youtube was more important) to leaving with less than what we arrived with, this was not an experience I would want anyone else to have, hence I am warning all of you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, cute”
Reviews.Author: qwerty1234567
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from a 3 day stay in Paris and stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of a Rick Steves book. The staff was friendly, though not extremely helpful. We asked about tours etc. and were told to grab a pamphlet from across the room. I would recommend looking @ tours and booking one prior to your visit as I had to book on my own. They have free WiFi and a laptop that they will let you use if you don't have an iPod or laptop of your own which was nice. The rooms were clean, small, but fine as we weren't spending our time in the room. One last detail the night before we left one of the staff members asked how we were getting to the airport and we told him we were going to take the metro to the RER. He said that the metro was slow on Sundays and didn't run until 6am and we'd be taking a risk by using the metro/RER. I had mapped out our route and looked up schedules the night before and was sure that he was incorrect. He ended up reserving a taxi for us and seemed to be inconvenienced by it. We went back up to the room and I looked up the metro schedule again which said "all trains start running at 5:20 AM..." so I went downstairs to show him and asked how their website could be wrong. All he could say is that he didn't know and we'd be taking a risk. We ended up canceling the cab he reserved and taking the metro/RER the next morning and were completely fine - even arrive 20 minutes ahead of schedule. Moral of the story - do your homework and don't believe everything they tell you. The next morning when we had the leave the hotel @ 5AM the front door was locked and the staff member that was supposed to be working the desk was sleeping at the foot of the stairs the led to the room downstairs. It took us 10 minutes to wake him up and let us out. I hope you have a better experience with this staff member than we did - sorry I did not catch his name.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Charm”
Reviews.Author: cathy041
Reviews.Content: This hotel had been recommended to me by friends who had stayed there a few years ago. (It's also a Rick Steve's pick) First of all, I can't think of a better location. In the morning, you can sit in a cafe and watch as the morning market opens on Rue Cler. It's within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and several other sites and is well situated for dining options. The hotel is the best induction to Paris - it is absolutely charming . . . and french! My room was a golden jewel with with deep yellow fabric covered walls and white accented furiture. Whilte compact, it was completely adequate and spotless. The maid service at the hotel is exceptional. Francois and Stephane were pleasant and helpful. when I arrived, I had lost my key for my luggage lock and francoise kindly assisted me in removing the lock so I could open my suitcase. Other guests that I met in their breakfast room in the morning were equally satisfied with the hotel. (don't miss the breakfast - it's a good deal and a great way to start a day of sight seeing) I will definitely stay at Hotel Du Champ De Mars again!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: John999939
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 2 day stay at this hotel. The location was perfect, the hotel is situated just off Rue Cler which is a fantastic street where we were within 10 minutes walking distance of The Eifel Tower. Our room was very very small, but very comfortable. I would definately recommend this hotel as being excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: susannroberts
Reviews.Content: We Were Surprised by Pleasantly no hotel choice and the friendly staff. The room was beautiful ! My daughter and I wanted a real Parisian experience, a comfortable and accessible location and a safe location. We were very well Taken Care of and "any questions about What We Had to take train to Versailles , etc. . Were All answered. We Felt Like We Were In The safety of Our Own home And The Hotel Is Perfectly Located so with fresh local fruit booths , great eating places and wonderful bakeries and crepe makers right there . A quick walk to the Eiffel Tower Was a great place to picnic everyday. Right around the corner Is the subway stop, just past the bakery ! We Will definitely stay there again MOST .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: clarke3011
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Champ de Mars was terrific! It is in a wonderful location just 1/2 block from the Rue Cler which is a happening part of Paris! Very close to everything including the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are a bit small but very nicely furnished and well worth the $$$. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cute, tiny, unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: aj
Reviews.Content: This place was super cute- very teeny tiny rooms but decorated nicely and clean. Overall the hotel was very quiet even in this busy area. The front desk guy- Im assuming the owner- is not friendly, will not offer any help and does not even acknowledge your presence, not even a smile. With that said it doesnt make it a very warm place to come home to at night. Oh well... what do you expect, its paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: excitedtraveller23
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for three nights. Before booking a hotel, we read various reviews of different hotels online. We saw that most people had a decent stay at Hotel du Champ de Mars, but that some thought the staff wasn't too friendly or helpful. We figured for the price and location we would give it a shot and hope that we had a better encounter with the staff. Luckily, we did. When we first checked arrived we told the woman at the desk that we were there to check in. I think she spoke some English, but she didn't seem to want to speak it. My husband knows a bit of French, so he spoke to her in French. She answered the questions that we had, but she didn't seem overly friendly. She guided us to our room, which was on the fourth floor. The elevator was small, that with our big backpacks, we could only use it one at a time. The hotel is right in the Rue Cler district, and has a great location for restaurants, stores, Eiffel Tower, and a subway stop. You could see the tip of the Eiffel Tower outside of our bedroom window. Being near a popular area, there was a bit of noise at night. However, we visited in May, so it was cool enough in the room with the windows closed. Having the windows closed kept out most of the noise. The room and bathroom were both clean and charming. We were very impressed with the cleanliness and appearance of the room, especially for the price that we paid and the location of the hotel. When you leave the hotel you must drop off your room key to the person waiting the desk. A few times there wasn't anyone sitting at the desk when we left, so we just left it there. That seemed to be an alright thing to do. The other people working the desk at various times were incredibly friendly and nice. The hotel offered a breakfast, but it was extra. We didn't pay for it, so I don't know how it was. Overall, we would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Dont expect much help from the owners!”
Reviews.Author: jp198090
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location (you can see the top of the eiffel tower from your room!) but in summer don't expect to get to sleep early as across the road is a row of restaurants that don't close till around 2 am and with no air conditioning you have to keep the windows open. The rooms were always made up and clean which was good and you had a small elevator to take you to your floor which was cute. However the two owners were unhelpful and gave little assistance especially when asked for directions, restaurants etc. There were no greetings upon entering and leaving each day and we had to ask three times for them to book our airport transfer and then that was wrong, with my girlfriend and i almost missing our plane! The casual reception clerk whose name we cannot remember (he called himself kangaroo jack) however was a breath of fresh air. He was nice, polite, talkative and unbelievably funny. Its just a shame he was filling in for another staff member and we did not see him on our last day. Overall this hotel was good to sleep in but if you come to paris without any knowledge of what to see or do or don't speak french (we did all our greetings in french to no reply) choose another hotel as you wont receive any here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Kirk000
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris for the first time in June 2010 and booked the Hotel du Champ De Mars . The hotel was recommended by several known guide books. We feel very fortunate to have found such a nice hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were very spacious (compared to the other ones we stayed in Europe), clean and quaint. The neighbourhood the hotel is located in (Rue Cler) is fantastic. Great little shops and cafes. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would stay there again. We have already recommended the hotel to several people who will be visiting Paris soon.

Reviews.Title: “A memory from the past”
Reviews.Author: Roger_Johansson
Reviews.Content: Between 1965 and 1969 I rented a room in hotel de champ de mars on the street rue de champ de mars a few times. I was a young hitchhiker from Sweden and I could seldom afford to live in a hotel. But this hotel was very cheap, 4 francs per night, which was less than one dollar then and is 0.40 euro in the currency of today. The owners of the hotel was an older couple, I got the impression that they were from Spain. I was very satisfied with the low price, the friendly owners and the location close to the Eiffel tower. I am happy to find that it still exists though it has probably gone through more than one renovation and change of ownership. Roger Johansson

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spot in the 7th!”
Reviews.Author: alease1420
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Champ de Mars was a home away from home for us during our recent stay in Paris. This was THE PERFECT location to see the sights, but still get a feel for real life in Paris. There were bakeries, cheese shops, wine stores, and chocolate shops all around and a great street market on Sunday! The rooms were on the smaller side, but nothing I have not seen in NYC. They were clean, well appointed, and cozy. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our window. There is no AC, but on our stay in warm May we were ok with the fan they provided (we didnt even have to ask)! I was nervous upon going based on some reviews about the staff, however everyone we encountered over the 5 nights we were there was nothing but friendly and helpful. Being polite and greeting or thanking in French didnt hurt! I think they must get bombarded with Americans following the Rick Steves trail. I saw no less than three couples carrying the book around in the lobby. You do have to book early and be patient. They take a little longer to get back to you, but its worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “Haven in the 7th arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: habs68
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for 8 nights and found this hotel after staying in the Grand Hotel Leveque for the first 2 nights and being disappointed. The owners (a couple) were gracious and the staff helpful. Speaking french goes a long way with the staff. The location of the hotel is fantastic, you're within walking distance of many attractions and the neighbourhood has a great pedestrian market street (rue cler). The hotel is quaint, clean, and the rooms are tastefully decorated. As there many decent cafes and patisseries in the area, don't bother having breakfast in the hotel's basement dining room. There is also a small supermarket a few doors away. This hotel is a gem - good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Lynda87
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely quaint hotel and the staff were very helpful. I especially liked the reception area with its cute little chairs and books of history of the area in Paris. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. The location was fantastic!!!!!! So close to Eiffel Tower and lovely restaurants. Would definitely stay here again! Thank you for a wonderful stay and being very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Central and handy”
Reviews.Author: RND22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice in Spring 2010. Stayed in first room for two nights in Mid May -- room was very small but clean. Returned the end of May for four nights - different room- much larger and a bathroom we could actually fit in. Again - very clean. I read reviews that the staff were often rude, but we never encountered that. (try a bit of French and everyone seems to warm up a bit)., Pretty central location and good access to both buses and Metro ( a few short blocks) Clientele in the hotel, the Rue Cler area, and restaurants, is pretty touristy (especial Americans due to the Rick Steves books and reviews), but I think it is a big challenge to try to find non-touristy places. The Rue Cler area is very nice, good restaurants, neat market. Breakfast is good (8 Euros each) but in a windowless basement (nice decor but still...),. Go across the street and sit outside at Cafe Marche or grab something at the boulangerie on the corner. All in all a good stay and we would recommend it. .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location; pleasant accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Valorie52
Reviews.Content: Love the Rue Cler location. I've stayed at this hotel as long ago as 12 years and find it one of the settings I'm happy to repeat. Pricing well matched to the accommodations and amenities. Laptop available to check out. Stairs could be a challenge for some, but not problematic for anyone able to walk Paris. Never use the breakfast as I love the Cafe du Marche next door and other cafe experiences.

Reviews.Title: “I felt at home and welcome from the moment I stepped in the door.”
Reviews.Author: MillValleyGracie
Reviews.Content: I was there at the time that the volcano erupted in Iceland. There was a lot of tension because departures were uncertain. The owners of the hotel accommodated many of us who were held over and made us feel welcome and did everything they could to to ease our situations. Madame Gourdal is the "Good Will Ambassador" for Paris. While the rooms were a little small, they were well appointed and spotless. The hotel is well located with lots of shops and restaurants near by. I would stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: MauldinFoodie
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated hotel in one of the best neighborhoods in Paris. You are a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel tower and delicious cheese/bakery/coffee shops surround this quaint hotel. The hotel's website over inflates how gorgeous it is but it's still very charming and warm. A+ for the cute cocker spaniel chillin in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Real Parisian experience”
Reviews.Author: Prekovici
Reviews.Content: We really liked being in the hotel Champs de Mars, especially because of the location. It's in the heart of 7th arrondisman, right on the corner of Rue Cler which is pedestrian area, full of charming shops and cafes, mostly geared towards locals, with very few tourist shops. In the morning you see all the moms rushing kids to school, people having breakfast before going to work and in the evenings cafes are full of young Parisians having few drinks and dinner after work. And all that in the area which is so centrally located that is great for sight seeing. Lots of sights are within walking distance, Eiffel Tower, Ecole MIlitaire, Les Invalides, Rodin museum to name the few. For the others sights, metro station is just around corner, as well as few bus stops. Our room was on a small side (usual for Paris), however suited us fine, as we were mostly out (it's Paris out there!!). It was very clean and with very comfortable beds. You can borrow a laptop from reception (free of charge), what we used to rent a car for our later trip in Provence. All in all, we found Hotel Champs de Mars to be a very good value for the money and will certainly recommend it to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, value, quiet”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanInUSA
Reviews.Content: Initially recommended to me by Lonely Planet, I and my friend have been staying at Hotel du Champ de Mars once a year for the last 3 years and will be using the hotel in the future for sure. It has an amazing location, we walk everywhere from it, it's very quiet, as we didn't hear much street noise or people in the hotel. We basically use the room for sleeping and shower, as we spent all day in the city. The room was cozy and with a character. Beds were comfortable. Bathroom was clean and bright. I really like that they have a notebook with free WiFi, which the guests can borrow into the room. This year, we were surprised that there were no a single english-language channel on TV, no BBC, no CNN, no euronews. I think they had them in previous years. We didn't use the help of the staff much, but the interaction was always pleasant with most of the people at the reception. overall, the hotel is as good as it gets considering the value, quality and location.

Reviews.Title: “Made Us Feel Like Locals”
Reviews.Author: gotwanderlust8
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending a week in Paris. In the past we've stayed in a different area in a larger hotel, but decided we wanted something different this visit. Hotel du Champ de Mars is in the Rue Cler area (7th arrondissement), an area popular with American tourists, yet in the heart of a residential Paris neighborhood! What a treat to stay with Francoise and Stephan and feel like guests in their "home" rather than their "hotel". The hotel is close to the Eiffel Tower and the Metro/bus lines as well as restaurants/coffeehouses frequented by locals. The rooms are charming...yes, small, but this is Paris. If you are looking for a modern, sleek, generic look go someplace else, but if you are looking for true Parisian charm and culture this will suit you well. The staff will make you feel welcome and will give you advice on what to do and where to go...enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mejimbob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found our stay at the Hotel du Champ de Mars most enjoyable. A quiet neighorhood with a local atmosphere, a small market next door for almost all of our shopping needs, and the "Cafe Central" just a few steps away. My wife and I preferred the "Cafe Central" ( their onion soup is a extraordinary ) to the the "Cafe du Marche" just across the street. The owners of the hotel, Francoise & Stephane, were very accommadating as were their employees working the front desk. Here's a tip: A short walk to the Eiffel Tower, then down to the Batobus water taxi on the Seine and you have easy access to the Louvre, Mussee d'Orsay, Notre-Dame, etc.

Reviews.Title: “CCC - charming, comfortable, cozy hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SiteSeeker
Reviews.Content: Do your research and you'll understand why this is such a great local hotel - excellent value in an ideal location with warm hosts and a perfectly french bedroom. By staying in a local hotel in a neighborhood (but still in the city with great metro access), you get a richer experience of the city. As fifty year olds, this was our first trip to Europe: we flew into Barcelona, night train to Paris, train to Mosel Valley Germany via Tier, train to Amsterdam and finally train to and flight out of Brussels. Paris was my favorite city and Champ de Mars was my favorite hotel. Again, do your research - know what to expect and embrace with openness. I looking forward to bringing my 21 year old daughter to this fabulous city and staying in this CCC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for price & location”
Reviews.Author: tych0
Reviews.Content: If you are travelling solo or are a couple wishing to stay at a hotel near the Eiffel Tower, I definitely recommend this charming hotel. We found it to be nestled on a very nice market street close to several Metro stops. The hotel room itself was tiny (I read reviews that everything here is small) but I was prepared for that. In addition however, everything was tiny - including the bathroom, hallways, and elevator. (If you dropped a bar of soap in the shower, you literally had to step out of the shower to bend over and pick it up) The rooms, however, were very clean and the concierge was extremely helpful in picking good restaurants near our hotel. We enjoyed our stay immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: funkybeagle
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended it is so cheap, shower was a bit small but at this price you cant go wrong

Reviews.Title: “Great value and super location...we stay here often...”
Reviews.Author: mrsdukesclass
Reviews.Content: These hoteliers take care to ensure that this perfectly situated hotel is comfortable and beautiful. I'm sorry that I'm only now taking time to share that I feel so lucky to have found it. April of '09 was my fourth stay, with my 80-year old mother that time. She, too, was charmed by the decor (the lobby has recently been refurbished) and the attention to detail. Francoise and Stephane could have easily raised the rates over the last few years, but have chosen not to. They are offering great value and courteous service. Stephane has arranged concert tickets over the phone for me several times, and other receptionists have made dinner reservations as well. The location cannot be beat, in the lovely seventh arrondisement (Ecole Militaire metro stop). Rooms are small, but immaculate and beautiful. I was sorry to see that someone complained about having to leave the hotel key at the front desk, since that is common European practice. I recommend this amazing "find" to anyone who asks.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LITTLE HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: taffyt99
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights with Francoise & Stephane at their adorable little hotel, right in the heart of the rue Cler district in Paris in April, 2010. What a GREAT location! And the hotel was absolutely charming. We loved our time there and would highly recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “'There's a small hotel . . .'”
Reviews.Author: trentechats
Reviews.Content: No wishing well but everything else you could want in a small hotel, close to the lively Rue Cler and under the shadow of the Eiffel Tower (well almost). My room was certainly small - what some travel books would describe as 'snug' - and the ensuite shower-room even 'snugger' but hey this is Paris and you won't spend much time in your room. The whole hotel appears to have been freshly re-furbished; the welcome is warm and personal - the price (for Paris) seems reasonable - and there's a plethora of bars, cafés and restaurants to choose from almost on the doorstep. And a metro station not so far away. Presque parfait!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Rick Steves said it was”
Reviews.Author: AmicaDiToscana
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to with metro, pretty, cheerful, colorful, very cozy, good price, friendly staff, good breakfast, great neighborhood--everything you could want if you are visiting Paris and you do not want to spend a lot of money on lodging. We will definitely stay here again and feel very comfortable recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, fully Parisian hotel right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: jgallman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for three nights in March 2010. It was very convenient to the Metro, the Eiffel Tower, the Rodin Museum, and a beautiful neighborhood that was fully Parisian called Rue Cler. Our room was small but fulfilled our needs completely. We had breakfast in the hotel one morning, and it was very good. The hotel has only 24 rooms, and evidently books up quickly, thanks to Rick Steve's recommendations, which is how we found it. The owners get varied reviews from other travellers, but we found them to be very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a true "Paris" experience.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to rest at the end of the day.”
Reviews.Author: kgrandones
Reviews.Content: The decor, quiet rooms with confortable beds, and friendly staff was a great place to relax after a long day of sight seeing. The convenient, cozy neighborhood makes you feel like a local.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: TEAAlefty
Reviews.Content: My niece, daughter-in-law, and I spent 5 glorious days in Paris. Part of the joy of our trip was the wonderful Hotel du Champs de Mars. The location, the nearby restaurants and metro, the comfortable beds, the efficient desk service for dinner reservations et al cheered us on a daily basis. To my delight, each bed had a strong reading light, a rare and much appreciated feature not found in many more expensive hotels. From the new chocolate and macaroon shop across the street to the friendly breakfast spot around the corner (the PTT Brasserie) this hotel is an incredible bargain in the City of Light. N.B.--Should you take a return shuttle to the airport, be sure to confirm the price before you leave the hotel with the driver---our driver tried to overcharge us, and we had to send him back to the hotel to clarify the price. Francoise was an ideal hostess---helpful and attentive to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: WorldWideFoodies
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself just returned from a week stay at Champ de Mars and everything you read in these reviews ( and Steves book) is true. Great location, nearby cafes are literally 100 feet from the hotel's front door and an extremely safe and inviting part of Paris. The rooms are as small as all say but well designed and clean. Staff was polite and hospitable ( not gregarious but this is not DisneyWorld either.) The value pricing of this hotel should really be the Number #1 selling point; the nearby neighborhood hotels are 30-50 Euro(35-55 USD) more and not worth the price-we looked at them to compare. Paris is great and expensive-save the $$$ lodging to spend elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “"The Best Small Hotel in Paris"”
Reviews.Author: mpopkin
Reviews.Content: I had booked a hotel in the Latin Quarter for one week. Checked in and found out that their elevator wasn't working and I was on the sixth floor in a "superior" single. Saw the room and immediately hailed a cab and went to my favorite hotel in Paris, the Hotel du Champ de Mars hoping they would have a cancellation. Slyn, at the front desk, did some master juggling and got me in the hotel for the week, moving a couple of times. This is the fifth time I have stayed at this charming hotel with a very welcoming staff and pleasant owners, Stephane and his charming wife Francoise. The prices are very low for this area, especially when you check out the two hotels on the same street. They are more than double the price of the HDCDM. I like the fact that in bad weather, I got some snow showers, you can literally walk out the front door of the hotel and within a minute you are sitting in a bar or restaurant enjoying Paris. Also, the metro is a three minute walk away and I used it quite often to go to other parts of Paris. Don't forget to book early, this hotel fills up fast!

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth it!”
Reviews.Author: rmoreno1254
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Paris and we had booked this hotel through reviews we saw on trip advisor. The hotel was clean, the people were very friendly and the basics were perfect! You can see the tower from the front windows since it is walking distance. Rates were very reasonable, I had talked with a collegue of mine and he told me he had gone to Paris and had a bad hotel, then said he had found this wonderful little place near the tower, he had said that even though he had no reservation and totally chanced it had a great experience, we soon found out that we had stayed at the SAME place. So there you have it 2 reviews in one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in amazing Parisian neighborhood. A true bargain!”
Reviews.Author: telleroftruth
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a few days in Normandy then headed to Paris on 12/31 in time to catch New Years Eve in the City of Light. The hotel is located in the heart of the Rue Cler neighborhood...a block from a Metro station and a few minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. You really can't pick a better location. The rooms are cozy, and the beds comfortable. For the price you can't get a better deal in the heart of Paris. I think those who complain about this hotel have unrealistic expectations. If you are used to large rooms with king beds and a lobby with a Starbucks you will be dissapointed. If you are looking for a great place to sleep in the heart of a true Parisian neighborhood at an affordable price you will be completely satisfied! In the mornings I would walk down the street to a local bakery and pick up a chocolate croissant and then head over to a cafe and do as the locals do...would eat the croissant at the bar with a cafe au lait. Or you can sit and have breakfast for about 5 euros...cheaper than at the hotel and you get to experience breakfast in a Parisian cafe. In the evenings there are a bunch of reasonably priced cafes to eat dinner. Be sure to try the Italian restaurant around the corner! Since this is a true neighborhood the prices are not inflated for the tourists and you will eat with the locals. You will love your stay at this hotel and neighborhood!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff, cozy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: violetfeather
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel and would stay here again. The rooms are cozy, the elevator and room tv's are small and there was no view from the windows, but I can't complain about anything else. It was a nice stay and the staff are helpful. I wish the breakfast had some eggs or meat though: just bread and yogart. Walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, lots of shops, restaurants, pharmacy, subway, paid parking lot, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Paris Feel”
Reviews.Author: sarahjanesandra
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in June 2009. The location could not be beat. We were maybe a block away from a Metro station and only a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower. The room was tiny, but expected given we were in the centre of Paris. The bathroom was fantastic. There was a very deep tub which was great after a day touring around Paris. The atmosphere in the neighborhood was great. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: jonwnc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 4 nights. It was our 3rd trip to Paris and we feel this was the finest hotel we have stayed at in Paris. The location is excellent. Only a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. The Rue Cler district is one of the most charming in Paris. We loved it. I have read some reviews that the staff was rude. We experienced the opposite. They were incredibly helpful with any concern we had. They made our experience even better than the previous 2 visits. We look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: tj_mct
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Paris and what a lovely place to stay; every night I looked out to a view of the Eiffel Tower. The rooms are pretty standard european sizes, nicely decorated and named. The hotel was spotless, there was a lift and the breakfast was good value. I travel with my own water boiler and mug so was easy to make a cup of tea to drink while using the free wi-fi. I found the lovely man on daytime reception to be very helpful and let me practice my poor french. I think some reviewers with bad experiences possibly didn't pay attention to french polite standards. Listen, watch and learn quickly for parisians are extremely polite people.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for my stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SDP_9
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 8 nights at the Hotel du Champ de Mars. I arrived early in the day tired from a long journey. In less than 5 minutes I was settled in a very comfortable room. I was on the top floor with great views of the neighborhood and the Eiffel Tower. The location was steps from the Rue Cler market with many shops, bakeries and restaurants. The Metro was minutes away providing easy access to all of Paris. I spoke to different people at the front desk. Each time I found that people were helpful and kind. Breakfasts were delivered minutes after it was ordered, I borrowed a laptop that I was able to take back to my room and shuttle service was arranged for my trip to the airport. Coming back to the hotel in the evening felt like coming home. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the neighborhood ambiance”
Reviews.Author: so_CalPica
Reviews.Content: The folks on the desk were wonderful; the resident cocker spaniel friendly. The rooms are immaculate. The best is the neighborhood - the Rue Cler market street, plenty of bakeries and cafes, and places to sit and watch the people go by. We don't recommend the breakfast, very basic, pretty pricey, and the neighborhood cafes afford much better variety at a much better price.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!”
Reviews.Author: AvidtravelCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My pregnant wife (7 months) and I went to Paris for a week on a babymoon. This hotel had great value, was in a fantastic location and the room was what one should expect from a non-chain Parisian hotel. The room was small by American standards but adequate for two people. We had a room overlooking the street and it was not too noisy (even for folks like us that live in the suburbs). The staff was helpful and never rude. They even arranged a ride back to CDG for us. There is a pedestrian street at the end of the block that has restaurants, bakeries, a grocery and plenty more. If you are an active traveler and plan to spend most of your day venturing out a museums, etc, this place was a nice place to come home to. If you want to be pampered, not the place: there is no room service. OVERALL: great place. We would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “All the charm we could ask for !”
Reviews.Author: DenverDork
Reviews.Content: At check-in, we could see that their primary goal was making sure we had a wonderful experience. Service was timely and always friendly. Plus, they helped us access restaurants, shopping, museums, or whatever we were looking for. The location was perfect--right in the middle of a village where we found dining, shopping, transportation, and most important...atmosphere !

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, but Quaint”
Reviews.Author: betterwithtwo
Reviews.Content: The service was sub par, but I quickly realized that this is simply French culture. They do not go out of their way to make you feel at home. They do their job and keep to themselves. The room was extremely small, but this is expected in a large, cramped city such as Paris. Everything was covered in yellow (the bed, the pillows, the bedskirt, the armoire, the walls!). We had no a/c, but there was a cool spell during our mid-July stay (high in the 60s). We slept with the large, updated window open on most nights (not the night the neighboring restaurant broke ALL glass bottles for about 2 hours). Showering makes the room EXTREMELY humid, damp, and hot--even with the windo open. During the day, we went sightseeing and left our window open to keep the air moving. The housekeeper always shut it, so it was always warm when we returned. I loved the location (7eme), which was within a 10 minute walk of the Eiffel Tower. It was very convenient to the Metro at Ecole Militaire and also north at Invalides. Right in the Rue Cler neighborhood, we were able to walk down the street to eat Italian and French for lunch and dinner. We also ate crepes every night at Ulysees', 100 feet from our hotel. I disliked leaving my room key at the front desk while we were out for 10 hours a day. The maids moved everything around in our rooms (towels, slippers, luggage, fans, bedding, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay; we will be back for sure”
Reviews.Author: Watchermontreal
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for 8 nights. Our room #35 was just great, nicely decorated, there was some storage so you can unload your luggages and even store them in the closet; it was a very practical room; bathroom is very ok; for 2 persons, the room was perfect. Francoise was wonderful to chat with; she loves flower, animals. Stéphane her husband seem to be more distant but he is not; he is probably more shy than anything else; we pulled a few smiles from him and all in all, they are very welcoming; their dog Cannelle adds a great touch to the hosting the guests; We could use their wi-fi laptop which was there for the guests. Close to Cler St, you have there, places to buy patés, wines (5 euros for a very good red wine), bread, cheeses, salads etc and the bistros are wonderful. We could even see the top of the Eiffel Tower from our room. We ate 4 times in our room and it was very romantic. We already miss that place and we will return at anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally rude and unhelpful staff, bad attitude !!”
Reviews.Author: traveloften07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10 nights in September 2009. My decision was based largely on Rick Steve's recommendation. I have travelled extensively and visited France a dozen times or more. The owners and staff at this hotel were incredibly rude, unhelpful and appeared to have a real "attitude" regarding their guests. Requesting a taxi must be incredibly challenging and difficult for them based on the reaction I received. EVERY interaction I had with the owners and staff was frustrating and extremely disappointing. The location and other amenities do not excuse or justify the staffs attitude!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience! Would book again!”
Reviews.Author: goreybopp
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a clean, comfortable hotel that was located close to one of Paris' major tourist attractions. This hotel fit the bill for my first trip to Paris! The room I stayed in was cozy and clean, and I loved being so close to Rue Cler, which is a street with lots of shops and markets. I was steps away from bakeries, fruit shops, supermarkets, and other gourmet food shops, so I was able to grab a quick and convenient breakfast before going sight seeing. Being minutes away by foot from the Eiffel Tower was wonderful, and I visited it several times, especially at night (when it sparkles)! This hotel is very reasonably priced and I highly recommend it to others who are looking to travel on a budget. It was also helpful to have free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay at the Hotel du Champs de Mar”
Reviews.Author: Memorable09
Reviews.Content: My husband, young son and I stayed in the triple room at the end of June. It was a very pleasant, clean and cozy room with a tres Parisian view from our balcony of La Tour Effiel and the Parisian cafe scene below. The neighborhood was very safe and pleasant with excellent access to grocery shopping, metro and Eiffiel Tower within walking distance. The front desk is very professional/helpful and the breakfast downstairs very quaint and 'french' style. We would highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for a place with a charming family style "Parisian" ambiance! Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable - Cute - Clean - Great Location - Even a View!”
Reviews.Author: ganglers
Reviews.Content: Just go home yesterday (9/22). Had 4 nights at this hotel. Loved it!!!! We had none of the hiccups or complaints that others have noted in their reviews - we didnt even see the potential of them. It may have to do with 2 things: 1)We were there after high season - July and August - everyone was telling us Paris is nuts then; 2) We smiled and said please and thank you often - we did notice that many did not . The old addage is true - you get what you give. Our front desk people we all great except one - no problem though - Slim on the next shift took care of our needs. BTW - Slim is great - super helpful, very understanding - got us dinner reservations when I could not myself. The room was clean, bright, very comfortable. We were in room 45 and looking out our window to the left could see the top half of the Eiffel tower - the room next to us (41 I think should also have a good view). For the view - ask for a room on the 4th or 5th floor facing Rue Champ Du Mar. You will have a little nightlife noise from the Brasseries down the street - but you also get a view. RE: the elevator complaints others have - get over it. Elevators all over Europe are that size. The breakfast the hotel offers is actually a pretty good deal. its continental - but for the price (8 Euro per) does the trick. A breakfast at the cafe across the street - which by the way was great - ran 16 euro per. If you are going to take a dinner cruise - Bateuax-Mouches was the one we chose. We chose the lesser expensive menu - but as foodies we thought it was great. There isnt a bad table on the boat. And they dont give you a lesser table based on what you pay, like some others. Best crepe stand we found: Down the street from Notre Dame in the row of souveneir shops(orange awnings). 2 euro - great quality. Just down the way from the that - a shop called Aux Vieux - had great deals on womens hats and the best quality scarves we found anywhere in the city. You wont miss it - look for the displays hats on the mannequin heads out front. Near the hotel, a couple of blocks down on Bousquet is Numero 7. Good restaurant, very good food, wine is reasonable - small staff, so expect slow service -but you wont be disappointed. RE: airport shuttle. We used Golden Air. The hotel website mentions them, but the hotel was telling us they are using them less and less. Golden Air prefers groups and high-line jobs. We found that to be true. The ride in was great. But the ride out was poor - we learned the hard way that we were not the only ones getting picked up by that car that day. The couple from Australia that we picked up were just as surprised. When you book your room, ask the hotel to set up your service with the other company.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location but very rude owner”
Reviews.Author: Emma066
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, excellent location for the Eiffel Tower and other transport links. The hotel itself was adaquate, rooms were small but that's what you get in Paris. Bathroom was clean and shower was good. However, lady hotel owner was extremely rude. When we arrived we requested to change to an upstairs room because our room was really hot and we wanted to have a lay down. She was NOT happy about this at all and started shouting about how we had moved a pillow on the bed and other guests would not be happy! She didn't seem to understand the concept "the customer is always right". And proceeded to rant about how you cannot get a hotel in England near the Eiffel Tower (relevant?). Apart from this I would recommend it to others. There is also a lovely dog that stays in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: tmr11
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend for a couple of nights at the beginning of a month long trip. Most of the staff was friendly and helpful. My luggage lock jammed while still on my suitcase and the attendent at the front desk found me some tools to use to try to break it open. The rooms were quite tiny (especially coming from Triannon Palace in Versailles) but the hotel was well located - close to the metro and close to the eiffel tower. Our room was clean. The one negative is that there was no air conditioning and we were on the 1st floor (that's one floor up in Europe) with a window facing the interior courtyard so we didn't get a lot of breeze.

Reviews.Title: “I Cannot Say Enough BAD Things About This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jills0182
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough bad things about this hotel. We stayed at the Hotel du Champ de Mars in mid-June of 2009. The trip was for personal leisure with my boyfriend, my cousin, and her husband. I should have taken it as a sign not to stay at this hotel when, previous to our stay, I made many attempts to contact the staff via email on their own website, and never received any response. During our June 2009 trip we stayed our first 3 nights in Paris, spent 3 nights in Rome, and then one last night in Paris. The first 3 nights in Paris we stayed in 2 different hotels and both were miles above Hotel du Champ de Mars in every stretch of the imagination. I am very grateful that Hotel du Champ de Mars was booked for the beginning stretch of our trip because our 1-day stay at this hotel was more than enough. Horrible! There are 3 reasons that I chose to book this hotel in the first place. (1) It was in close proximity to the Eiffel Tower, (2) it was highly recommended by Rick Steves, and (3) the photos on the website appeared very cute for the low price. After staying here, I wonder why this hotel comes recommended at all. The rooms are decent, but beware that the single rooms don’t leave you any extra walking-around room. The price is okay for the area (close to the Eiffel Tower), but to avoid their rude staff, I personally would pay an extra 10 euros to stay somewhere else. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were greeted (this is much too friendly of a word for his demeanor) by an attendant at the reception desk. After giving our name, he just blankly stared at us. I think he was counting our number of guests (only 4 of us) and was confused because they had us booked in one double room and one single room. Mind you, we confirmed the reservation no more than a week prior and had booked 2 double rooms for 4 people. Needless to say, the hotel was completely booked so we were stuck with the incorrect booking…yet charged the same price as if we had 2 double rooms as originally booked. We tried to haggle with this since it was not our fault they overbooked their hotel, but the desk attendant kept stating as long as 2 people were staying in the single room, we’d have to pay double-room price. Oh, and he added, if we didn’t like it, we could leave (and that is pretty much a direct quote). Yeah, at 6pm on our last night in Paris, find a new hotel and still be charged cancellation at this one…I think not. We were stuck with this hotel at this point. Our room (the one my boyfriend and I had) was on the ground floor. It was a decent size and pretty cute. I will attach some photos. The cleanliness left something to be desired though. Wrappers (of who knows what) left on the floor, and many many hairs (ick!) on the bathroom floor and shower. I have photos of this too. It seems like they may have come in and made the bed, but did nothing else. It makes me wonder if they even changed the sheets. Luckily there was a window in the room (that looked directly into the window of the room across the way) and a fan in the cabinet, because this hotel did not have air conditioning. My cousin and her husband’s room, if I remember correctly, was on the 5th floor. There is a tiny elevator (which is common for Parisian hotels to only have a small one if there is one at all), but 5 flights of a narrow circular staircase is a long hard walk even if you are not carrying a suitcase. Since their room was incorrectly booked as a single instead of a double, their bed was a full size bed and the room was only about a foot wider on each side of the bed. Very tiny. The bathroom was also very tiny. I don’t think they would have minded the tiny size of the room as much if they would have at least had a bed that fit the 2 of them comfortably. When we left the hotel later that evening, we were stopped halfway out the door by the desk attendant stating that we would have to leave our key at the front desk.
