It took us by surprise (since this was never mentioned when we arrived at the hotel) and I have to say we didn’t feel 100% comfortable leaving all our belongings in our room with him having the key to enter…especially with the rude way we had been treated upon our check-in. I guess that is why we had bought luggage locks before the trip. Later that evening we left the hotel again to do some sight-seeing and the desk attendant was not even at the desk for us to drop off the key. We had to wait in the lobby while a 3 other couples also piled up in the lobby to wait. Eventually the desk attendant sauntered out of the bathroom to collect the keys, but only after I had the chance to read a magazine. Overall, our stay at Hotel du Champ de Mars was unpleasant. The rooms were decent in décor, but they were not clean and the desk staff was beyond unpleasant and rude. I can’t imagine they would have been of much help if we would have needed help with anything or needed tourist information. And the desk attendant upon leaving in the morning was equally as rude as the one the night prior. This one ignored us and stared at the computer in front of us and did not look up until he was greeted first. And then his only greeting was to correct our French. This hotel gives French staff a bad reputation and was our only unpleasant encounter of our 8 day trip. My opinion is that they think they can get away with treating people in this manner because being in a foreign country you do not have much recourse against them, and they have a steady stream of tourists and no need for you to be a repeat visitor. In hindsight, I would stay at Hotel de la Paix (the hotel we stayed at our 2nd and 3rd nights in Paris, only a few blocks away and closer to the Eiffel Tower, and the staff and rooms there were excellent) instead or try something in the Notre Dame area. Never again would I stay at Hotel du Champs de Mars and I would never ever recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean”
Reviews.Author: Azniv
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just fine. Clean rooms . I'm used to five start hotels but stayed her becasue I was with friends. It was fine and a GREAT location. You must try the cheese shop across the street. Restaurants out the front door and to your right. For the price this hotel exceeded expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Will Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Wizmanna
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I found this hotel charming. Granted we arrived in the middle of the night, in the poring rain, saw the Eiffel Tour in the distance, and got lost, but eventually we got there! When we arrived our reserved room was waiting for us, we had no problem making advanced booking. Our room was tiny (cozy,) with a very small table with two chairs, an armoire (with a fan inside,) TV, and very small bathroom. Everything was clean, nice looking, and we felt very safe and comfortable inside this hotel. The location of this hotel could not more perfect. We walked to the Eiffel Tower park (Champs due Mars) in less than 5 minutes, picking up local produce and fresh treats along the way. There are two cafes that we truly miss, right below the hotel, Cafe du Marche and Cafe Central. We recommend you skip the hotel breakfast for 8 euros, in favor of smaller breakfast at one of these cafes, or go to the bakery on the corner for some yummy bagettes, quiches, croissants, and other baked pastries. We also walked up and down the Rue Cler (lost of produce and shops,) and fell in love with Ulysse Crepes. A must have! Everything else in Paris is easily accessible by the metro. The metro stop Lecole Militaire is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, and the whole metro system is very easy to use and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: dottyp1
Reviews.Content: This was great. After previous posts, I was looking forward to meeting the formidable proprietesse, but, alas, she was not around. All staff were polite, although not overly friendly. The hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms were small (of course, in Paris), but the beds were comfortable and the shower was good. The room was charmingly decorated, as you can see from photos that people have posted. The location could not be better. All around were beautiful streets full of charming cafes and small shops, and there was a real buzz to the area. We ate out for breakfast - expect to pay about 6 euros for a breakfast of fruit juice, croissant / pain au chocolat and coffee or tea. The metro is nearby (Ecole Militaire), but you can walk to the Eiffel Tower and other similar attractions. The hotel is very close to some fantastic areas. It's also easily accessible from the Gare du Nord in a taxi (about 10-12 euros as far as I remember). For a hotel in this area, prices were really reasonable. We paid 90 - 95 euros a night for a twin room with shower. I'd recommend this hotel, especially for its fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: tw7
Reviews.Content: Was there in March 2009. The room was small (but it is in Paris). The office staff was great but the cleaning staff not so nice (not mean, just not nice). I would live there if I could.

Reviews.Title: “Very rude receptionist”
Reviews.Author: joybell27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, the neighbourhood is very nice and it is close to the metro. Nearby there are cafes, restaurants, bakeries and a couple of small supermarkets. It is also just a few steps from the Rue Cler. For a two star hotel the room was a good size, it was clean and the double glazing cut out the street noise. The bed was comfortable however what is advertised as a large bed on the hotel web site is actually a double. There is no air-conditioning and as the weather was around 20 degree every day while we were in Paris this was not a problem. We had a view of the Eiffel Tower from our window which was particularly lovely when it was lit up at night. Now for the bad. When we arrived we received the coldest welcome that I have experienced at any hotel that I have ever stayed in and I travel a lot for work. I had read the reviews about the reception staff on Tripadvisor and to be honest I was a little sceptical. I thought that maybe previous reviewers didn’t attempt to speak French or perhaps that they were expecting too much at a two star hotel, but sadly this was not the case. To begin we had to wait while the receptionist, who I think may also have been the owner, was chatting on the phone and when she finally spoke to us she was very terse. As we walked to the lift she shouted at us “one person only in the lift with luggage”. After viewing our room we had a question about the size of the bed. We very politely went down to reception and stated that we did not have a problem with the room but we wanted to check if we had been given a room with a large bed. The response was a tirade of abuse. We were told that “you are not in your own country now, this is how we do things in France, this is the way we live, you have a large bed’. We were shocked at the extremely rude and aggressive response to a simple question that we had asked in a polite manner. We returned to our room and as soon as we walked in the door the phone rang. When my husband answered he was told that if we didn’t like our room we could “get out” the next day and that we were to let her know in the morning what our decision was. We were really shocked, we had never said that we were unhappy with our room or the hotel we had simply asked if we had been given a room with a large bed. What a horrible way to be welcomed to Paris. At this point we really felt like changing hotels. We checked at the Hotel Valadon and the Hotel Bosquet, which are both located just a few steps away, but neither could accommodate us for our entire stay. We decided that we would continue to stay at the Champ de Mars as we did not want to waste any more valuable holiday time searching for another hotel. The next morning we went down stairs with great trepidation only to be greeted by the same receptionist who simply said “bonjour have a nice day”. There was no mention of the previous day’s conversation and whether we were going to stay on. From this time on the receptionist was polite and always said bonjour or au revoir but she was never friendly. I never once saw her smile except when she was petting her dog. My husband and I had trouble writing this review as we understand the impact that a negative review can have on business but we wanted to give an honest opinion. The hotel is a good standard two star in a lovely location. However the rudeness of the receptionist when we arrived was so awful that we could not recommend this hotel There is simply no excuse for treating guests so rudely. If we return to Paris we will not stay here and we recommend that you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but most unfriendly owner/staff”
Reviews.Author: travelmaker4
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in this Paris neighbourhood this time and originally planned to book at the nearby Hotel Valadon (well rated in TA) which unfortunately was booked out. Hotel Valadon was kind enough to suggest & send us a list of the nearby hotels. In the end we booked with Hotel du Champ de Mars. Location of the hotel is great, very convenient for the Eiffel Tower and Invalides, with shops and restaurants/cafes just around the corner in Rue Cler. There is a wonderful bakery, chocolate store, deli and cheese shop. Hotel room is small but is relatively cheap for Paris. The owners/staff were not that friendly however. Luckily we were familiar with Paris, we didn't have to ask them for information. The few times we had to speak to them eg during check in and check out, they were not all that friendly especially the owner's wife. She was manning the reception on the morning we checked out and was having a good old chat and joking with a man at the front desk when we came down. We waited patiently and she completely ignored us. After a long while we decided to get her attention as we had a train to catch and she didnt look like she was going to stop talking to the man. She was not happy with us and her friendliness and smile disappeared instantly and was quite blunt.

Reviews.Title: “charming room, great location”
Reviews.Author: gingerpu
Reviews.Content: Our blue room was so pretty and charming. It was just the right size for my husband and me. Location is perfect, very convenient for the Eiffel Tower and Invalides, with shops and restaurants/cafes just around the corner, and the Ecole Militaire metro stop 2 blocks away. I counted 3 groceries in the area, with the biggest one near the metro stop. Along Rue Cler, there's a Chinese-owned rotisserie that sells tasty chicken. There are also a bakery, chocolate store, deli and cheese shop. The owners and staff were not exceedingly friendly but were not rude either. Since we knew our way around Paris, we didn't need to ask for information from them and so never had the chance to be disappointed by their alleged lack of enthusiasm to provide it, as previous posters have claimed. One thing I must complain about is the noise at night. I didn't think we'd have a problem with a room facing the street but the noise from the 2 cafes at the corner were really bothersome. One night the revelry went on until late at night. Good thing it suddenly rained and the noisy customers had to disperse. Other than that, our stay was quite enjoyable. We felt safe and never encountered any problems coming home past midnight. We used the in-room safe to keep our passports and other valuables (but not money) and nothing was lost.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: KellyMNewYork
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an amazing neighborhood, with easy access to the tourist attractions most people want to see when in Paris. The rooms are small, but clean - especially the bathroom. I paid 89 Euro (roughly $125) a night for a single room that had a full size bed, flat screen TV and a dressing table and mirror. The bathroom had a shower stall as opposed to a bath tub but it did have a hairdryer. Closet was ample size for hanging clothes and had shelves for other items. I really felt this was a great value for the neighborhood and especially for the city. I thought the staff for the most part were pleasant. Let's face facts - people are all different and some were nicer than others, but I didn't think anyone was outright rude, although some were more willing to chat than others. Perhaps a language issue ( I don't even attempt to speak French) , but I didn't feel it an issue enough to make a big deal about it or trash the hotel because of it. At least the people there were themselves and not a bunch of phoney people bowling you over with fake sentiments acting like you are some long lost relative. I was treated like a customer - no more, no less. Breakfast is served at the hotel for 8 Euro, which included fresh squeezed orange juice, breads (French bread, croissant and cake) as well as yogurt and fruit salad. Ample enough to start your day, and a reasonable enough price. I think most people need to remember that this is a small privately owned hotel in a great neighborhood in one of Eurpope's most visited cities. When you consider the price per night, you need to realize what you are not going to get every bell and whistle a more expensive hotel has to offer. But what you do get is a clean and decent space to stay at a very reasonable price. I think that since you are going to Paris for the city and the sights, spending hundres of dollars on a hotel room you will only be sleeping in is a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty hotel in beautiful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Jenny15X
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and really adored it. Our room was pretty small, but decorated super cute and always very clean. It had a TV, a wardrobe to stuff your luggage in, a table and chairs to get ready at in the morning, and a super clean modern bathroom. In the morning when we were getting ready we would open the window and we could hear the bustle from the street, the setting up of the fruit stands and just daily noise. It was nice. We didn't buy the breakfast as there were 2 really good bakeries just near the hotel that we chose to grab a pain au chocolate at each morning (also a nice crepe place, try the banana nutella!). The hotel is really close to the Ecole Militaire metro stop (which smells like pee) and tons of great restaurants (we really liked Le Bousquet and Chez Agnes!). The hotel had a funny little elevator that was like, barely big enough for two people. There was also an ATM close by to the hotel. And one of our favorite memories was putting together a picnic from the market produce on the street outside the hotel. We went to each of the different shops buying cheese, bread, fruit, wine, treats, ect. Then we put it in a backpack and ate it in the gardens at the Palace of Versailles. It was all around one of our favorite meals. The hotel staff are not the type to be overly friendly on their own accord, but they were always kind to us and helped us with what we needed when we asked. We arived to Paris from the states at about 9:00 AM. The hotel staff held our bags and told us that if we just wandered around and gave them 45 minutes, they would have our room ready for us early. Which was unexpected but very nice of them. They also arranged for a taxi to pick us up the day we left and it worked out great, no problems. The hotel owners have the cutest dog, Canelle (means cinnamon). I recommend petting Canelle! We doted on the dog because we thought she was super cute, and in turn had a good experience with the staff. Maybe it's a correlation?

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Location, Horrible Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LoveJourney
Reviews.Content: Our room was tiny, dark and the bed was so old and uncomfortable that we could not sleep. The "restaurant" serves breakfast only, which was bad and over priced. The staff was very unpleasant and did not know how to use the room safe and so could not even explain to us how to use it. We carried everything valuable on us and were quite thoroughly uncomfortable and tired (due to lack of sleep on the bad bed) the whole time. The hotel was not clean. There are plenty of small hotels in Paris. I suggest you find another. We will.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for an amazing price - not sure about the owners..”
Reviews.Author: sputnam
Reviews.Content: Firstly I must start by saying that this hotel is AMAZING value for what it is. Its in the nicest area of Paris - a stones throw from the Eiffel Tower - and in a beautiful street with a wonderful market. I couldn't choose a nicer location. A hotel in this location would usually be ridiculously expensive. The rooms were very clean and sweet. We had a room overlooking the street which gave us a lovely Parisian experience when at night you could hear the gentle clinking of glasses from the restaurants below. As most of the reviews say - the owners weren't the friendliest of people but if you are quite independent and like to do your own thing anyway I can't see this being a problem. We asked to order a taxi at the end of our stay and they sent us to find one on the street which I didn't really appreciate. The man behind the desk didn't welcome you warmly whenever you came into the hotel which I feel is really disappointing because with better service, this hotel would be amazing. Highly recommended if you want a clean, good quality hotel in a perfect location but don't need alot of help from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: itsmydayoff
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Rue Cler neighborhood and is simply wonderful!! The Eiffel Tower is less than 5 min walk away. This neighborhood is charming and so special! The rooms were small, but that's expected in Europe. The staff is nice and helpful. I've stayed in this hotel three times now and will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and lodging, but REALLY rude staff”
Reviews.Author: roselle73
Reviews.Content: I read so many great things about this lodging through Rick Steves. We were so excited to stay here, but were sorely disappointed right from the start. Upon check-in, the clerk was rude and dismissive. He actually rolled his eyes at me, and told me I was ridiculous for thinking a hotel in Paris would have parking for guests. (After I was told via e-mail by staff that there was indeed parking for us.) He then misinformed us that our car rental company was open. So we wasted over an hour on a wild goose chase. THEN, upon leaving, we requested a taxi for the morning. Instead they sent an airport shuttle for an airport we weren't going to. And they charged us 30 euro for a 5 minute ride to our stop. Thanks again. We never felt as though the staff was there to assist us. It seemed as though we were always inconveniencing them. God forbid we interrupt their web surfing! Even to drop off our keys, they showed such disdain. Why?? I really have no idea. I made efforts to speak French, asked if they spoke English, and they relunctantly agreed to speak English with us. But it all seemed like such a hassle for them. Positives- the room was clean, roomy, and a great location (4th floor, obstructed view of Eiffel Tower.) ONE woman was kind. I don't know if she was an owner. She had her dog there in the lobby. And as a fellow dog-lover we were able to strike up a conversation. I have mixed feelings about this hotel. The price was decent, the neighborhood is fantastic, and we enjoyed the room. But 75% of the staff really needs a course on hospitality and human decency.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Charming!”
Reviews.Author: catguy411
Reviews.Content: My husband and I marked a milestone in our lives with a trip to London and Paris. The Hotel du Champ de Mars (7 night stay) was delightfully charming. Our room and bathroom were very clean, and the beds were so comfortable. Our view was of the courtyard. Because of what I'd read on tripadvisor, I asked at the front desk to be moved to a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower if one became available. The owner explained that all of the rooms with two beds like ours did not face the tower because of their size, and that made perfect sense to me. The location is amazing - a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower, around the corner from the Metro (Ecole Militaire) and close to many buses (took Rick Steves' recommended #69 bus tour-great idea). Surrounded by beautiful specialty shops with exquisitely designed windows for browsing. Small supermarket a couple of doors down. Many places to eat - we favored Le Bosquet a block away - yummy soups, entrees, exceptionally nice staff. Around the corner from LeNotre with out-of-this-world chocolates, pastries - this is a must see shop. Easily got Wifi (password from the front desk) on my ipod touch and sent emails and checked museum hours, etc. Our encounters with hotel staff were excellent. We interacted with Slim on the later shift the most, and he was particularly helpful and a pleasure to talk with. We booked an airport limousine via Slim; this was reasonably priced and meant we didn't have to drag our luggage on the metro. On the way to the airport, the driver answered his phone and said it was a call for us. I had left my phone in the room and the staff at the hotel went to the trouble of tracking me down! As the phone was a rental and would cost us much $$ if not returned on time, the driver took us back to the hotel to pick it up. This kind of service by both the hotel staff and the driver is exceptional. We are so grateful. We were 100% satisfied. Merci mille foix, Hotel du Champ de Mars! We hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Unfriendly service.”
Reviews.Author: johnnykrz
Reviews.Content: Well, the location and price were great. The room was nice, although we would have preferred the tower view some people mention rather than the back alley. The bed was horrible. Neither of us slept very well and I think I still have bruises where the springs were digging into me. The owners, I think they were, were very rude and pompous. They would barely look up at us when we tried to be nice and upon asking the lady where to find a nearby antique shop, she acted like we were idiots for even thinking someone would be open on a Monday (as if we were supposed to know). Of course, we walked ONE block away and found the antique shop. What do you know? It was open, so I was sure to let her know when we got back. Then, when we checked out, the man was a complete jerk. I will not stay here again just based on the way they treat their guests. There are plenty of other hotels in the area that look just as nice or nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely home at Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lamhk
Reviews.Content: I had my stay for 8 days in this charming little hotel (20-28/1/09), the room is small but beautiful just like shown on the web. I liked to open the window, sipping wine while looking at the eiffel tower. That's so lovely and "Paris". The location of rue cler is so convenient & gives you a local residence feel. My favourite is "Cafe champ de mars", "Cafe Constant" & "Secco 200". It's nice to have good restaurants around so that after sight-seeing all day & return "home" having a relaxing dinner. You can stay late & it's just so safe around. And, I found the hotel hosts friendly. My wife liked to play with the host's dog & feel like being at home. I would definitely recommend this "home at Paris" to my friends & indeed my wife can't wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “J'Aime le Hotel du Champ de Mars!”
Reviews.Author: OOFA
Reviews.Content: I chose this charming little hotel because of a Rick Steves recommendation, and I was not disappointed. While the staff were not bubbling over with personality and friendliness, the location was excellent. I had a view of La Tour de Eiffel from my window (Chambre 56). The room was small but adequate and charmingly decorated. The proximity to rue Cler and other grand sites was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to experience Paris as a local.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, mediocre room and service”
Reviews.Author: kstarChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Champ du Mars for 5 nights in November, and were very much anticipating our stay based on some great reviews from TripAdvisor. The highlights were definitely the location with immediate access to the Rue Cler and only a few blocks away from the Eiffel Tower. I would highly recommend staying in this area, it was lovely! However, the service and room left much to be desired. The room and bathroom had not had a thorough cleaning in some time, and we had to ask daily for a refill of soap. The staff was quite aloof and overall lacking in customer service. I understand this is more of a budget hotel, but even in that classification it was lacking. I would recommend finding another value in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Malvid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four nights. The location in the 7th arondissement was excellent. It was close to the metro (Ecole Militaire), rue Cler which had a great market and cafes, within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Rodin Museum, as well as the RER line to Versailles. Even though our room was small it had character. The bathroom was also small but clean. Our towels were changed daily even though we did not request it. However the main receptionists were not very helpful (especially the woman - rather glum). Despite the hotel indicating that WiFi was available we were not able to get the internet on our laptop. They told us the password but the site asked for a user name which they were unable to help us with. However, on our last night there was a young boy at reception who was able to help us with our internet connection. we did not have breakfast at the hotel as there were many cafes on rue Cler. We thought the price (90 euros/night) was good value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “A Great taste of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: SFGAL78
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the heart of a Paris neighborhood. You really can't get a better location! 10 walk formt he Eiffel Tower or to the metro (which will take you anywhere you want to go). This charming hotel is in the midst of a quaint neighborhood. The rooms are beautiful (small), clean and cheerful. Nice bathroom in the room. Delicious breakfst served for an additional price. Staff are very helpful nice.

Reviews.Title: “Been there, done that!”
Reviews.Author: MJ454
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in 2004 and decided to give it another try this past November 2008. The rooms are very small, as are most in Paris. It was clean, plenty of towels, bathroom was nice as well. The only complaint that I really have is the lack of personality of the owners, particulary the gentleman. He rarely speaks, even to those that are fluent in French, and is very standoffish. They do not like to accommodate anyone with special needs...i.e. coming in late, using the iron, etc. I know there are other hotels in the area at a good price with comparable sized rooms and friendly staff. We frequent Paris a lot and I will not stay at this hotel again. I have always defended the idea that the French are "rude" but staying at this hotel makes that statement very hard to refute.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: lisa63Vancoouver
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel for the second time, having stayed for a week four years ago. The location is great, a lovely market street and restaurants just steps away. The reception area and breakfast rooms have undergone a very nice reno since we were there. However, the staff is the most unfriendly group of people I have encountered in the hotel business. They barely look up from behind the front desk when you arrive and don't make much of an effort to engage in conversation at any time. Breakfast is very good, fresh croissants, breads and jams are excellent. However, the staff seems so disinterested and almost bothered having to serve you. They were the same four years ago also. But if you want a good location and reasonably good rates, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: JessandJerry
Reviews.Content: Wow great location, you can see the effiel tower from the hotel and the invalides are even closer. The location and price cannot be beat. The rooms were small but adequate, the bed comfortable and most important clean. The staff weren't exactlly helpful and when we asked to leave our luggage a couple hour past checkout, we were told we could leave it in the corner in the front lobby (i wan't exactly thrilled). But overall the experience was good and the value even better

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, good price”
Reviews.Author: sadie100
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay - good value for money and great location. We coud stroll to the Eiffel Tower every evening! Rooms were clean, warm, quiet and comfy (except for one lumpy pillow). The staff were very nice, and overall for 94 euros a night it was a lovely place to be. Have to say that we didn't bother with breakfast so I can't comment on this, there were lots of nice cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Poor insonorisation”
Reviews.Author: Forsythia99
Reviews.Content: Located in Paris near the Eifel Tower. It has 29 rooms. Moderate rates. The rooms are very smalls and the bathroom even smar- ler. The hotel is clean. I spent three nights in oct 2008. Reception at desk is not the warmest. The breakfast is convenient at 10 euros. The surrounding of the hotel is very quiet. Located in a small street with little traffic. The problem comes more from the inside with a very poor insonorisation. The privacy is taking a beat. The elevator is also very noisy. I was gone to stay a week at this hotel but because of the noise level, I cut it in half.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Canoehead8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to Paris for our 30th anniversary this September. We picked Hotel du Champs de Mars using Rick Steves book and Trip Advisor ratings. We were not disappointed. I have osteoarthritis so I have trouble with stairs and the hotel had an elevator which was a big bonus. Our room was #15 on the first floor with 2 windows overlooking Rue Champs de Mars. The room was spotless. Not nearly as small as I had heard they were. We had a double bed, a small table, chair and ottoman. It also had a closet with shelves and a safe. All of which came in handy. The bathroom was a good size and spotless with a tub and shower, sink and toilet. Being disabled it was a bit difficult to get into and out of the tub because the sides were so high but that happens in a lot of hotels in North America too. The room was beautifully decorated French country in pale wedgewood blue. The windows (those french doors!) were lovely. And it was very quiet in the hotel. Some street noise from the cafes on the corner but that was done by midnight and we are nighthawks anyways so that was not a problem for us. The hotel offers a lovely breakfast for 8 Euros. It has croissants, fresh baquettes, pound cake,jam, butter, orange juice, yogurt and coffee. Believe me that is a bargain in Paris. If I had to say one negative about the hotel, and I am really stretching it, it is that the staff is not overly friendly. That is not to say they are rude, just not the smiley how are you today type. That is my only negative. The location is fantastic. Would be hard to find better. You are right on the corner of Rue Cler, in the hub of restaurants, cafes, bars, shops and patisseries. You can see the Eiffel Tower, it is about a 5 or 10 minute walk and in the other direction about the same distance is Les Invalides. You are about 5 minutes from the Seine. The RER (the commuter train) is about 10 minutes away. All in all we were thrilled by our hotel. Some of the negative reveiws I have read makes me wonder what they were expecting for the price they were paying. I found I got much more than I could get for the same price in North America. This summer I spent $125 for a motel in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. So to spend 90 Euros (Aprox $135 Canadian) for a hotel like this with such an atmosphere of Paris, was truly a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Paris Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jillmet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel based on the reviews I read here on tripadvisor. I was relieved that the reviews were true when we arrived at this adorable little hotel! The lady working at the desk was nice and there were no complications. The room was small but comfy. I could not have asked for a more perfect hotel in Paris! You can't beat such a cute quaint neighbourhood and a well kept, safe, comfy hotel in such a incredible city! There are lots of bakeries, cafes and grocery stores nearby. There are also a lot of great restaurants less than a block away! I just loved this hotel and would most definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a true taste of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for an overnight trip in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AZTravelerz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night before catching a train to the Loire Valley. This is a great hotel for a quick stopover on your way into or out of Paris. Rooms are small (typical of Paris), but clean. Nice location within close walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and Loire River. It is also very close to the Metro (Ecole Militaire) and RER (Pont d’Alma) which makes it easy to explore to city.

Reviews.Title: “Little Parisian gem”
Reviews.Author: Zoukie
Reviews.Content: A quaint little hotel with many Parisian features. Good location close to the Eiffel Tower and other sights. However some cons were that it was very small, had no aircon or fridge, and the lift could only fit 1 person at a time. Beware the back stairwell - it feels like you will fall through!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: CanadaCouple58
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Hotel du Champ de Mars is its location and value. Very convenient to the metro and bus system, great sources around the corner for fruit, cheese and lots of restaurant choices. The room size was great for Paris. It would be best to come to Paris knowing what you want to see and how to get there since we found that if we asked the staff for any help we were inconveniencing them greatly. Remember the hotel is not air-conditioned, and with the temperature of 38 degrees C (96 F.) at 8:00 PM many nights the fan in the room was not quite enough for a good sleep. Try to be clear on the rules of phone usage as we had some confusion regarding the fees at the time of check-out. This this the first time that we have stayed at a Rick Steve's recommended place and left disappointed, particularly regarding the interaction with the owners/staff.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: joshuafayle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our honeymoon in Paris. We stayed at the Hotel du Champ de Mars. The rooms were great and the owners were very nice and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ozzie00
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night only as we were travelling around the France but have to say that the location was a real bonus. The hotel is only minutes walking distance from the Eiffel tower so we could experience it both during the day and night. It is also a walking distance to the metro station which will take you to all major attractions. Sometimes you need to change lanes but it is fairly easy. We bought daily tickets (unlimited) which was great as we didn't have to worry about the transport. If you are on a budget, there is a small supermarket right next to the hotel and a little pattiserie on the corner of the street where you can buy your basic food. The pattiserie was wonderful with all the fresh bread, flutes, croisants, you name it, they had it and it was all fresh. Loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charmingly sweet”
Reviews.Author: inthegarden5
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this quaint little hotel in Paris and now I'm doing the same. It was perfectly located to major attractions, but yet out of the way of the really expensive hotels in tourist areas. It is situated by a charming little street called Rue Cler, which is so picturesque with outdoor markets for flowers, cheeses, breads, meats. The hotel is small and very accomodating, close to the metro and next to a supermarket and bank. The price was very reasonable, although they charge 8 euros for breakfast (for a small yogurt, one croissant, slice of pound cake & a piece of baguette, fresh o.j.and coffee) which I suppose wasn't too over the top (compared to my $21 hamburger at the local cafe) but it was convenient to have in the morning. The hotel has a lap top for their guests to use which is nice. It is operated by a husband and wife, which were very helpful and lent us a travel book on Paris (Rick Steve on Paris). Their website is www.hotelduchampdemars.com You'll love Paris! Bring your comfortable walking shoes though (everyone wears flats there) because the streets are wobbly brick or cobblestones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nancie77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the very Parisian Rue Cler area, filled with shops, cafes, and colorful markets. If comming from the metro turn left as you leave the metro, left on Rue Cler just outside the metro, then left on Champs de Mars, the hotel is right there on the left. The lobby was a little quirky and we were wondering if the rooms were going to be the same. Luckily the rooms were normal and rather cozy. Our room had a double bed with a night stand on each side. There was a table with 2 chairs, an armoire for our clothes, and a working TV. The bathroom was fairly large with a shower/tub combination. The staff was effiecient, some were very talkative and fun, then there was one who was constantly on the phone yelling at someone on the other end, very unprofessional. Breakfast was not included but the charge was 8 Euro per person for coissants, jams, cheeses, juice and coffee. We only did that once and found better places that cost less. We felt the hotel was worth the 80 Euro a night price and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brent_kate
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading a review in the Lonely Planet and found it to be an excellent hotel in a fabulous location. The room was not overly big but you can't really expect large spacious rooms in Paris anyway. They were clean and decorated tastefully and it was a pleasant room to relax in after spending long days out seeing the sights. With the metro so close to the hotel, it was extremely easy to get around. Rue Cler is lovely market street and sometimes it was hard to believe that we were in the iddle of Paris as opposed to a little town. I'm a travel agent and even though we don't sell this particular hotel, I have been recommending it to all my Paris bound clients due to its fantastic location, clean rooms and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Wonderful Location, Ideal”
Reviews.Author: Vinovixen
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel for a quick getaway to Paris. We paid 90€ per night for a room with a double bed, and I honestly don't know how you could find a better place this nice, this centrally located, for this price. A friend from California recommended the hotel to me. She always stays here. I brought my mom to Paris for a two-night getaway (her first trip), and wanted her to stay somewhere nice. The rooms are lovely, well-appointed; the reception area is modern. It's only a few blocks from the Parc Champs de Mar (and Eiffel Tour), and only a few steps from the lovely Rue Cler. I highly recommend this place. There are some negative reviews about their online responsiveness. I too found that you need to call them to make a reservation -- just sending an e-mail is not enough. My only other comment would be that our room was quite small -- as was the shower. This is typical in Paris, but if you are overweight or very large, you should inquire about the size of the rooms and showers before booking. We are both petite, so it was perfect for us. The hotel has an elevator and a small dining room downstairs where breakfast is served every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time as Great as the First”
Reviews.Author: ACMC75
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this beautiful little hotel. The best features are the quaint French style and the excellent location. The rooms are small, but decorated nicely and with everything you need. Fresh and clean. The location on Rue Cler is the best. Just as Rick Steves describes it. The perfect cobblestone street to enjoy a pastry, a cafe au lait and shop for a picnic. The rooms have a hair dryer, a safe and television with CNN. Our room overlooked a small courtyard. Last time we stayed in room which overlooked the street, which I really enjoyed. Opening the large windows in the morning to look down on the street cafes below was a true European experience. I do agree with other entries that the reservation process could be easier. And the front desk staff is polite, but not overly helpful. But that does not matter at all when you remind yourself how reasonably priced this hotel is (for Paris that is!) Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: JLord24
Reviews.Content: We arrived at about 9:00 p.m. on Sunday the 6th and the check in process was a breeze. They simply handed us a key and sent us to our room. The hotel is incredibly close to the Eiffel tower and we immediately headed over to Rue Cler to grab a bite to eat and then over to Champ du Mars for a wonderful view of the tower bathed in snow flurries. We stayed in a triple and though the room was small (double with a rollaway?) the beds were comfortable and the room/bathroom were extremely clean. The hotel has an excellent location. Close to Champ du Mars, Rue Cler, Trocadero, and the Metro. I found this to be the perfect location from which to explore Paris and we will definitely return. I've noticed that a few of people have had issues with reservations. That is unfortunate and will certainly effect their business if it continues. For my part, I confirmed via email after reservations had been made, confirmed 1 week prior to arrival via email, and arrived with reservation and confirmation printouts in hand. We didn't need the printouts and I don't know if it would have made a difference if we had needed them, but I felt that I had more ammunition should they contest the reservation. Provided you don't have reservation issues, this place is a true deal in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Deleted/Lost my Reservation”
Reviews.Author: tac_123
Reviews.Content: I had planned my trip to Paris to stay at this hotel for the past three months. I had a confirmed email reservation at this hotel dated 01/09/08. I called first, however, the owner told me to make my request through email. On the day of my departure 3/21/08, my flight was cancelled due to a snowstorm, all flights out of Milwaukee were cancelled, causing me to miss my connecting flight to Paris. I was fortunate enough to find a flight leaving two days later. I immediately called the hotel and explained my situation; the person who answered the phone (Stephane) assured me that the room was still available. We had been traveling for a good 16 hours and so we were very relieved to finally arrive at the doorstep of Hotel du Champ de Mars. I proceeded to check in. When I told the clerk my name, he asked me if I was the one who called. I responded that I was. He said I didn’t have a reservation and asked me if I had received an email (which apparently was to tell me my reservation was cancelled). When I told him the person who I spoke to on the phone said I still had a reservation, he tried to figure out who it was. Based on the time I called, he believes I spoke with Stephane, one of the owners. He said Stephane was wrong. Apparently their computer system “deleted” my reservation, to which they had no way of tracking down my original reservation. I asked him if he could do anything about this situation to which he responded by blankly looking at a piece of paper as though he were genuinely trying to do something and said no. I asked the clerk if I could speak to Stephane. Stephane was not available according to this clerk. The clerk sent me off like some sort of vagrant to another (sub par) hotel which was very dirty and depressing (Hotel de la Tour Eiffel), not the French “charm” I had hoped to find at Hotel du Champ de Mars. Additionally, I had made a reservation at the Jules Vernes and gave them Hotel du Champ de Mars’ phone number. When I called the Jules Vernes to confirm my reservation, they said they were going to cancel it because Hotel Champ de Mars told them I wasn’t staying there. Finally, with the help of the Paris Tourist Bureau I found a nice clean hotel, Hotel Caumartin Opera. Still it was difficult to shake off the initial bad experience during my trip. When I returned home, there was no email from Hotel du Champ de Mars at my work or home email address. I had to give Stephane both addresses as the emails weren’t reaching my home email. For whatever reason, the hotel could receive the emails I sent from my personal email account, but I never received any emails they sent to my personal account, my reservation was confirmed with my work email—I did not receive the alleged email informing me that I did not have a reservation at work either. I don’t care how charming or desirable a hotel “appears” in a travel guide book (Rick Steves), I will never again make a reservation through email alone. It’s unfortunate that my original flight was cancelled, but Champ de Mars should have never told me my reservation was going to be honored just to give me the runaround such as they did.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ozasis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came here for our honeymoon and spent 5 lovely nights. We loved the friendly service and loved their dog Cannelle( Cinnamon in french). We found the rooms to be delightful. They were small but very liveable and newly decorated. We had a beautiful view towards Rue Cler. This is possibly the best food street we have even been to. if you like your food then this hotel is in a prime location. Short walk to the Eiffel tower also. Great for the photographers out there! Highly recommend and look forward to return in the not to distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Not Honest People”
Reviews.Author: AMCWEMWFMW
Reviews.Content: I communicated with the staff of this hotel via fax and email. They asked for and received my credit card information to hold a room. I called 2 weeks before our departure to Paris to confirm we were all set and was told that they were booked and had no more rooms available leaving me to scramble to find another hotel 2 weeks before our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sailor5552
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel in a guidebook and double checked the information with Tripadvisor reviews. The hotel is just 25 rooms and charming. The rooms are small by American standards, but well, you're not in America. Just pack lightly. The private bathrooms are modern and clean. I don't need a lot of hotel services, so why pay for them? The front desk was helpful, and the owners let us borrow the laptop in the lobby to check email. The Rue Clar hotel area was a great place to start and end the day. Shops for wine, fruit, cheese, bread, take away meals and pastries abound, and the location is very close to The Eiffel Tower and Metro (which is clean, fast and easy to use). I do not regret going at the end of January. Being from New England, I'm used to cold weather. The days were low 50's F with no rain. Definitely a walkable city. Nothing was in bloom yet, but there were no crowds and no lines at the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: julianneandbpb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel du Champs de Mars for about 10 days at the first leg of a month-long visit to Europe. Over-all our experience was fine. Our room was small, as most of the reviews we had read agreed. The decor was somewhat charming but it really WAS very cramped in our room. Also, the carpet looked in need of re-placement, seemed worn and kinda dirty. The very best thing about it was the location, SO close to the metro stop, a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides and the Seine. With the great farmers market just out the door it gave the impression of being part of the locals yet very convenient to all the tourist sights. Stephanie (him) and Francoise (her) were pleasant enough. They were cooperative--reserved and dignified as most of the French people seemed to be. I don't think we would stay there again just because of the size of the room or common areas (tiny lobby too.) My husband would have liked to spend some of his time relaxing in the room or hotel (to give himself a break from all the art museums I wanted to see!) but the hotel just was not condusive to that. I think it was a reasonable value for the rate but would plan to spend a bit more money for a nicer place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation process”
Reviews.Author: atkinsonguy16
Reviews.Content: I cannot review the hotel itself but I would like to comment on their reservation process. In November 2007, I e-mailed the hotel through their www site link requesting a 3 night stay in May 2008. I got no response to my e-mail. A week later, I sent the same e-mail and noted this was the 2nd request. This time I did get a response several days later saying they were not taking reservations for 2008 until January 2008. On January 2, 2008, I sent the e-mail again requesting the same 3 nights in May. No response to my e-mail. On January 6, I re-sent the e-mail. No response. Figuring it was worth the price of a phone call, I telephoned them on January 11. A rather rude woman answered the phone and asked me for my dates. I gave them to her and she said, "Sorry, we're full for that period". So I would suggest that if you must stay at this hotel, forget about e-mail and call direct. Subsequently to the call, I had a most pleasant experience when I called the Grnad Hotel Leveque [on Rue Cler] and spoke with Christophe. He set me up with one of the newly refurbished rooms for only a few euros more than the Champs du Mars.

Reviews.Title: “Rue Cler Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: castroy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the third floor and had a beatifull little room. This room is very small but adequate. We stayed in September and had such nice weather. We left the window open and had such a nice ambience. It had a nice table with two chairs where we enjoyed wine and cheese from the market. We could also see the Eiffel tower from our bed which made for such an awesome night. Other than the rooms are small. This was such a quaint hotel. We could here music every morning that was something out of a french movie. the staff is not always too friendly but they were helpfull. The location is great fo getting to anywhere in the city. The metro is two blocks away. The Eiffel tower is three blocks away and Rue Cler has so many cool shops and restaurants. If you are looking for the perfect location go here...Get Rick Steves travel Guide book and you will be set...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great location...”
Reviews.Author: liziek
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and a friend recommended this hotel to us. The rooms were very clean and bathroom was a good size. Excellent location !!! The area was the best - only a few minutes from the tower and the metro. A lot of restaurants and markets. The shopping was great and the River Seine was also right there. You can walk to almost everything. We will come back to Paris with our girls and we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Champ de Mars”
Reviews.Author: euromerp
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a six night stay at the Hotel du Champ de Mars. This was my second stay at this hotel - I stayed here about a year ago with a friend. This time, I was on my own. The hotel was great! My single was actual a small double and it was nice to have a double size bed rather than a teeny twin. The room was charming and clean with a shower that had great pressure and hot water everytime I used it. I found the hotel staff to be friendlier and more helpful on this stay - I know some people who have stayed here have had issues with the staff. And still, the neighborhood cannot be beat. The Eiffel Tower a mere five minutes away. The Rue Cler practically at your door step. It just doesn't get any better for a stay in Paris - not at this price, anyway! I will return to Paris again - and I will be staying at the Champ de Mars!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: jerseyretiree
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a 2 week stay at this charming hotel. It exceeded our expectations in the 3 areas of most concern to us as travelers--facilities, hospitality, and location. We stayed in room 35 (violettes) on the fourth floor facing the street. It was more than adequate in size. The bed was queen size and very comfortable. The chifforobe was recessed in an alcoveand was plenty large enough for hanging garments and had shelves-and a safe-for everything else. There was a luggage rack but we saved space by putting our luggage under the bed. The windows were thermal clad, about 8 feet high and opened inward (french style). Outside the window was a Juliet balcony style grille topped by window planters. The bathroom was modern-tub and shower, all white tile, pedestal sink and built -in hair dryer. Our room had a round table and 2 parson chairs where we enjoyed our wine, cheese, and fruit each evening. The owners' hospitality was evident in the care and thoughtfulness throughout.The room was spotless and the decor charming.The first thing we noticed were 2 wine glasses set on a tray on the round table.The decor was blue with toile pattern drapes over semisheer drapes at the window. The bed linens included a matalasse coverlet and 3 decorative throw pillows in a coordinating pattern. The desk clerks were polite and efficient. After about 3 days I met Mrs. Guidal when I returned for our room key because I forgot my sunglasses. I apologised because just about every day I was sure that I would forget something. (they do request that you leave the key at the desk) She was very friendly and soon we were speaking about families etc each day. We met her husband and were introduced to their lovely daughter, a university student. Francoise even recommended a restaurant for our last evening in Paris--it was a lovely, intimate dining experience that was the perfect ending to our stay. The location is the final plus of this real gem. It is around the corner from Rue Cler , an upscale pedestrian market street. There are boulangeries/patisseries at both ends of the block and the local restaurants provide the evening street life. The metro is a few minutes away and you are about 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower which we coul see lit each night from our hotel room window. We could not have had a better hotel experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Bruins99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I felt this was a good value. The hotel is a bit worn, but definitely clean. Our room was small. I laughed at people who mentioned that in their review prior to my stay. I still enjoyed it, but lauged when I realized I had been warned! The staff was unfriendly at best. We loved the location. A very charming neighborhood and close to the Eiffel Tower. We would recommend this hotel and stay again. Friendly staff would be nice, but we'd prefer a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: hapitraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Hotel Du Champ de Mars and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The hotel is quaint with lovely bright rooms, a comfortable bed, good shower and clean, modern, but still charming furnishings. The reception staff spoke English and were always very helpful. Location wise this hotel was fabulous, right near the Eiffel Tower and next to a market, great/ affordable restaurants and shopping. This hotel really made our Paris experience special and we will certainly stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: Laurie2525
Reviews.Content: My grown daughter and I celebrated our birthdays in February. The hotel is very clean, and the location is wonderful. The rooms were small but adequate. We walked to the corner cafe for breakfast, but the hotel served breakfast, or you could get it delivered to your room for a modest 7 euros per person. We did not care about a health club, spa or restaurant, just a clean nice room. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: oileanach
Reviews.Content: As I was travelling solo this no-frills hotel was ideal. I had no use for a dining-room, pool, spa, concierge service, gorgeous view, valet parking... Just a quiet room, comfortable bed, adequate shower and toilet. Instead of the 7 Euros hotel breakfast I paid under 3 Euros at either of the two corner cafes and took in the local scene. As I expected from some reviews the owner ignored me; but when I had occasion to consult him on my final day he proved most helpful and quite affable. Biggest plus: SUPER LOCATION just off the charming Rue Cler. On New Year's Day I strolled over to the Eiffel Tower, and after my ascent I caught a boat for a trip up the Seine past Notre Dame. The rest of the week the Metro whisked me in minutes to all the must-see sights.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel.....wonderful neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: Foodienearnewyork
Reviews.Content: Our reservation for a room for three had somehow slipped through the cracks....without hesitation Mrs. Gourdal, the owner, provided us with two rooms for our 4 night stay with no extra charge! Love the rue Cler neighborhood and the wonderful sense of community you can immediately enjoy as you step out side the hotel and wander among the streets lined with outdoor cafes, patisseries, fromageries, markets and boulangeries with the baguettes being made behind the windows. Having visited Paris and the rue Cler before, I know that I should expect a smaller room. With Rick Steves advice and our own experience, we packed light and used small suitcases. Our two first floor rooms were charming, clean, accommodating and quiet. With regard to other reviews wherein criticism was made of the lack of warmth from the owners and staff.....perhaps respect for privacy and a difference in culture was mistaken for coldness. The French are wonderful people....different to us....and isn't this why we love to travel....to experience something different? They are more private....respectful of others space....after all they have less of it to share and, I have found, they are careful not to intrude. I have also learned that they are wonderfully responsive when a 'request' is made for assitance rather than a 'demand'. Waiting for my family, I would spend time in the lobby reading and I found that many guests asked for help with a demand that, while may be the way to get help in the USA, sounds disrespectful and rude in France. The old adage of 'when in Rome do as the Romans do....works wonders. After all, if we make the French like us.....why would we want to bother to travel there! Our experience at this hotel was one of comfort on all levels for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Happy to be going back May 2007”
Reviews.Author: moebile
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in room # 21 from 29 March-7April 2006 and thrilled to have secured a reservation for 6 nights in May 2007. The hotel is perfect for our needs, easy on the travel budget and the owners and staff are helpful and friendly. It is located in a quiet neighborhood with cafes, small grocery stores, flower shops, fresh food stores of all types, cheese store, luggage shop, linen shop, really cool & crowded (with two customers and one owner) shoe store (looking for the newest Mephistos?) the best pastry shop in the world, post office, atm, internet shop, metro stops and centrally located for major Paris sightseeing or shopping. We could see the top of the Eiffel tower out our window and walk to it in 10 minutes. It rates excellent for us. Jay & Teri Moe Waupaca, Wisconsin, USA

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: brgreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here based on the Rick Steves' recommendation. It is in a convenient charming Paris neighborhood. Like other reviews, the rooms are small and the staff is aloof. They were helpful when I asked them direct questions but they were not outgoing. We had room 12 which was small and faced an interior courtyard but was blissfully quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Get the right room”
Reviews.Author: Tandem40
Reviews.Content: I agree that for the price this hotel is perfectly adequate. It is clean, bathrooms modern, very well sound and light proofed and the location is safe and somewhat charming. I must admit, though, that the lack of friendliness in this case did bother me more than usual. It sort of colored our experience since we didn't feel fully welcomed. I don't want or expect hotel workers to fawn over or be overly friendly, but simple courtesy goes a long way. Afterall, this is their business, which is to serve their clients. A few more smiles or bon jours are definitely in order. Also, the rooms seem to vary greatly. We spent one night on Nov. 8, 2006 and then 2 more nights on Nov. 16 and 17 and paid the same price 84 euros for all 3 nights.. The first night we had room 21 with a streetside view which was wonderful. It was roomy enough too. The last 2 nights we were in room 12 facing the dumpy little courtyard area, and the room was miniscule. We had to put one of our 2 suitcases under the table. Even the bathroom was smaller. It was very disappointing after having such a nice room the first night. Would I stay here again? Probably not, unless Hotel Leveque on Rue Cler and Hotel Jeanne D'Arc in the Marais are booked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice price, great location, shame about the owner”
Reviews.Author: MAK2000
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value, well decorated hotel in a really quaint area of Paris. The rooms are pretty small but well decorated and comfortable. Please just be aware that the owner is not very friendly, verging on rude. I would seriously consider not going back to this hotel for that reason alone but you have to balance this against the fact that it is very reasonably priced and in a lovely area. But having said that why should I give my money to someone so unhelpful and grumpy. What a shame, why doesn't he sell it to someone nice and then the place would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel du Champs de Mars-good value, lacks friendliness”
Reviews.Author: bdib
Reviews.Content: My mother,husband, daughter and I just returned from a 16 day trip to Switzerland and Paris. Based on Rick Steves recommendation and the price we chose this hotel. We stayed 7 nights and for the location and price 84 euro/single and 105 euro/double with cot it was good. Our room consisted of a reg. sized double bed and cot. Needless to say, the room was small for the 3 of us but charming. The bathroom was spacious and modern. My mother's room was the same size but the bathroom was smaller. Cleanliness was great the first few days but towards the end was sloppy-toilet paper and tissues not replaced, floor not vacuumed. Breakfast was filling but became boring. Fresh squeezed orange juice, plenty of coffee,1 croissant per person, baguette, yogurt. We would have liked to see some variety in the bread--maybe a brioche etc. The men who covered the night shift would feign ignorance but upon persistence would reluctantly help with info. One of the owners was always there in the daytime, the husband was extremely aloof and not helpful or friendly, Stephanie was more helpful and personable. No friendly introductions here. Location was good but the variety of reasonable restaurants in the neighborhood serving French food was limited. Everything you hear of French people is generally true in Paris. They are not very friendly or helpful to visitors, even to someone who speaks French fluently.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed in the City of Light”
Reviews.Author: Bambi_Boulangerie
Reviews.Content: I loved our room (#4, Lilas) at the Hotel du Champ de Mars. It was done up in shades of yellow, and there was a TV, telephone, armoire, table & chair, nightstands, blow dryer, and a shower/bathtub combination. The front desk staff, with the exception of a middle-aged woman, were quite nice. The middle-aged woman at the front desk neglected to give me a message from a friend in Normandy that was due to arrive in Paris! The hotel's location is in a very safe neighborhood, around the corner from the rue Cler market and within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower. The owners also have a dog who sleeps in the lobby. My only other problem with this hotel is that the night watchman did NOT answer the door one evening when I came in at 4:30 a.m., so I had to make myself content in the doorway until another guest was leaving about 30-45 minutes later. On the following night, I secured a promise from the front desk that the door would be open for me, with my key on the desk, even if I came in at 4:30 a.m. again, which I did. As they'd promised, the door was unlocked and my key was on the front desk; the night watchman locked the door once I came in, however.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: lroccaf
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this hotel in March. The hotel is nice. The rooms are very small. However, the neighborhood is wonderful. We ended every night at the Eiffel Tower which is only a few minutes walk away. The neighborhood is very safe. The hotel has a very good rate for what you get. We paid around 90 euros a night. However, don't eat the breakfast at the hotel. It is only bread, a croissant and coffee and juice for 7 euros. You can get better food nearby as there are many shops in the neighborhood. My husband had a problem with the hot and cold water. It kept going in and out so he could not get the temperature right. There is no air conditioning so this hotel may not be ok for a hot Paris summer. However, in March it was about 40 degrees so it was fine. The electricity converter we bought did not work with our digital camera or my curling iron so be advised that you may have no luck either. The owners are not rude, just very standoffish. Don't expect them to be overly friendly, they won't. Other than that I would stay there again as the value for what you get is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “great affordable hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hibachi
Reviews.Content: There are lots of positive reviews on this hotel, so I'll try to provide some additional info that I haven't seen in other reviews. I stayed here in a single room for three nights. The hotel is a great value for the price and I will definitely stay there again. The room was very clean, insuite bathroom, TV and phone. Plenty of hot water; a hairdryer was available. Staff were very pleasant. I didn't have breakfast so can't comment on the food quality, but frankly with the food market right outside and a wonderful bakery and other resources in the neighborhood, you don't need to eat at the hotel. As other reviews have mentioned, the only downside I can think of for the hotel, is that it doesn't have air conditioning, so it would likely get hot in the room during the summer. My window opened into a little interior light shaft, so I didn't get any street noise even with the window open. The hotel is located in a nice little neighborhood right off Rue Cler, which is a Parisian market street. During the day there are lots of food vendors selling produce, cheese, etc. There are multiple restaurants on the street, and more within a few blocks' walk, and a tiny convenience store about a block away that's open quite late (until at least 10:30 or 11 pm), which is great if you want to buy a bottle of wine or something late at night. The area seems very safe and I had no qualms walking around alone at night. While there are a few restaurants that are open late, it isn't a "party zone" so noise doesn't seem to be a big problem. The hotel is about 5+ min walk from the nearest Metro stop, and 7-10 min walk to the Eiffel Tower or to the Seine. It's also 5-7 min walk to a light rail station, which is convenient for when you're going to Versailles. The downsides for the neighborhood is that because it's way over near the Eiffel Tower, it is further from all the other sights (Louve, Latin Quarter, Marais, etc.) so you end up taking the Metro a lot. Also because it's a mostly residential neighborhood, there's very little shopping (other than food shopping), and really nothing to do at night other than go to a restaurant (ie, no movies nearby, etc.). Also there are also a LOT of Americans who stay in this neighborhood, so you're more likely to hear English spoken on the street than you are to hear French.

Reviews.Title: “An Extraordinary Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a good friend while in town to run the Paris Marathon! As we had changed our reservations around a little (more on that later), we ended up having to switch rooms after our first night. We found both rooms to be very clean, tastefully decorated, and of more than adequate size (though still smallish). Both rooms faced the front of the building, giving us views of the top of the Eiffel! The bathrooms in both rooms appeared to be completely renovated and were bright and clean, with plenty of hot water, and good water pressure. The second room even had a built in hair dryer! The location is what makes this an extraordinary value. A few mere blocks away from the Eiffel Tower, with a metro stop just on the other side of the block on which the hotel sits, and every imaginable service you could want somewhere within a block and half radius--cafes, wine shops, chocolatiers, pastisseries, a grocery store, a dollar store, a laundromat, produce markets, a butcher shop, cheese shop...really, the list could go on and on. Decent street life by night, relatively quiet in the morning, it was a joy! The Seine is a comfortable walk away, and we even walked to the Orsay one morning and to Champs Elyeses the morning of the race. The service was fine, though communication was sometimes difficult, but we always got what we needed. Be aware that they have a 7-day cancellation policy. Under 7 days, if they cannot re-book your room, you will be responsible for paying. Luckily, this little charm is popular enought that our three canceled nights were booked again in no time. Internet access, if you need it, is iffy. There are no terminals, nor wifi available at the hotel, though the staff was gracious to allow us behind the desk late one night to simply check our e-mail. There's supposedly an internet cafe one block over, but we were never able to catch it during open hours. Unless you simply MUST have four star service, I don't know why you would consider booking anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the Price”
Reviews.Author: StanduMan
Reviews.Content: Our expereinces at the Hotel du Champs de Mars were entirely positive. The location on a quiet street near a pedestrain market street was ideal. The service (check-in, maid, and breakfast) was friendly and professional. The room was surprisingly spacious, with a table and two chairs in a corner by a window overlooking the street (an ideal spot to share some wine and cheese). A recent travel article in the "New York Times" recommended a different hotel in Paris as being reasonably priced at $230 a night. That same amount would get one three nights at the Champs de Mars - what a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “a great pic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent choice. I would definitely reccomend it to others. yes like other reviews the room is smallish compared to "American" rooms, but definitely comfortable. I was expecting a tiny bathroom, but I believe it was of good size for "European" standards. The bathroom, was clean, spacious, good water pressure and hot water. The housekeeping service made the bed each day, but didn't thoroughly clean each day. Other than that the bed was plenty big enough for my wife and I, and the mattress was good. A great price for a cute, quiet little place so close to the eiffel tower and metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Margaret057
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September 2005. Our room was in the front, and we had a view of the Eiffel Tower, especially beautiful lit up at night. Our room was small, but immaculate, as was our washroom. The location was perfect, with Rue Cler a stone's throw away. We walked to the Eiffel tower 3 times, and toured the neighbourhoods. Great little restaurants, and patisseries. We loved the atmosphere, and felt we weren't in a totally tourist area, which of course we were. We're going back in September of next year, 2007, and are definitely booking to stay there again. The only thing I would say was missing, the staff could have been friendlier, but all in all they were fine, and we loved our experiences there.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip, Mar 7 - 12 here. Could not have been happier with the hotel. Great location in the 6th...about a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, and less than 3 minutes from a Metro. Metro stop is kind of "in the middle" of the system, so it was always easy and quick to get anywhere. Cheese shop across the street, great bakery on the corner, plenty of non-touristy meal options within walking distance. There is a supermarket next door that sells wine for 2 or 3 euros, bottled waters for .50 euro, etc...very cheap prices for items that you might like to keep in your room. Hotel is very small...rooms were small, but standard by European sizes. We were in room 21. Nice bathroom, charming decor in room. We did face the street, and it was fairly noisy at night. But, we loved being able to open a window and see a "Parisian" street...we truly were the only tourists in most of the stores and restaraunts we went into in the area. Did not see much of the staff, but the gentleman on the night shift went over and above in assisting us with our early morning flight out of BVA. We had no clue what we were doing, and he walked us through every step. Much appreciated. They do offer a suplementary breakfast, but we found it was cheaper to purchase a cafe and croissant at the bar across the street. Highly recommend this for anyone looking for a great hotel find, comfortable, in a great area, at a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Coupleloves2Travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to make your headquarters for your trip to Paris! We stayed for five nights, and loved it. Of course, the rooms are small, as they are at all French hotels. But it is very clean, comfortable ... and the location! Literally next to Rue Cler and all the wonderful cafes, food stores, and shops, just a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower (and the walk through the most amazingly beautiful neighborhoods of Paris!), a couple of blocks from Ecole Militaire and the Metro stop of the same name, a market next door for sodas and snacks. The innkeepers are wonderful, too. OK, so they're not very chatty and are very businesslike, but we needed a taxi at 5:30 a.m. on our last morning, and we had no problem arranging it at all. We'd stay again in a heartbeat. Actually, we're staying there this fall on our return visit. (Yes, we've fallen in love with Paris and are making another visit!) Definitely consider this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nts in Apr of 2005. The room was quite small but charming decorated in yellow and blue and quite clean. The location was great as we had only to walk around the corner in the mornings to the open market on Rue Cler. We were close to the metro military ecoles and an easy walk to the eiffel tower and a little further to the Seine. If you are looking for a nice budget 2 star I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Parisian hotel for a very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: mericet
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Hotel du Champ de Mars in April 2005. We had a double room on the first floor. The room was of average size (for Europeans, Americans might find it too small). The room was lovely furnished and always clean. The bathroom was tiny, but had a tub and was also very clean. The hotel is situated on a silent street near the Eiffel Tower. Next to the hotel is a market street with restaurants, cafes and food shops. The next metro station is just a few minutes away. Breakfast is served in the basement, we haven't tried it, but I would definitely do so next time, because you will not find anything cheaper (quite the contrary) in the neighbourhood. I would stay in this hotel again, but would probably ask for a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor, because our room was in the back of the house and therefore we did not get much light in the room

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but beware of the tub”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just completed a four day stay at the Hotel du Champs de Mars. This is my second stay. In anticipation of writing a review, I did some approximate measurements and tried to be very observant. Here are my comments. The room was about 10 feet by 11 feet -- "Parisized." It contained a double bed which was comfortable, two tiny night stands, a tiny table, a small chair and a small cabinet for hanging your clothes. The cabinet had 8 hangers (2 skirt), 2 shelves and a safe. On top of the cabinet is a small TV. My room --22 -- looked out onto another building but was very quiet. There are four rooms to a floor. The room is extremely small but if you have limited suitcases and are friendly with your traveling companion, two can fit in the room. The bathroom is tiled. The length of the bathroom is the length of the tub. Next to the tub is the water closet and the sink. It is cozy. My only complaint is that the tub is dangerous. The only way to get in and out of the tub is at the back of the tub and the back of the tub does not have rough surface -- so slipping is a real possiblity. Next time, I am going to bring my own mat. There is a small breakfast rooom downstairs. The food is fresh because I watched the staff go next door to buy oranges and bread. The cost is 7 Euros. I like this hotel very much -- no one is very friendly -- but it is very clean and the price is oh so right. The neighborhood is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Hotel du Champ de Mars”
Reviews.Author: tcreath
