Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel du Champ de Mars in November and had a really nice stay. The hotel was in a great area filled with interesting restaurants, cafes and shops. The hotel is also in a fabulous location for touring Paris; close to the Eiffel Tower, Invalides and several Metro stops. Our room was on the small side but very nicely decorated, and with a wonderful view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. All of this for a wonderful price; I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Troubadour
Reviews.Content: The Hotel du Champ de Mars has an excellent location around the corner from Rue Cler, opposite the Café du Marché, close to the restaurants on Rue St Dominique, lots of shopping opportunities and an Internet café nearby, and the Eiffel tower also turns up now and then. Our room (12, the Dahlia) was clean and warm (snow outside), and having been to Paris before, we did not get upset by the lack of a single smile at the reception in the three days we were there. As for restaurants nearby, we found the Café du Marché friendly, Constant's Les Fables de Fontaine overrated and Café Constant pleasant; but we had the best service and food at La Fontaine de Mars. All these three are on Rue Saint Dominique, a five minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Champ de Mars”
Reviews.Author: ledris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Champ de Mars on Rue Champ de Mars for 4 days the first week in Nov. 2005. WE stayed in room #44 right across from the elevator. Being off season this was fine as there was no noise from the elevator at all. I must say that the elevator was very small. One person and 2 small carry on bags/2 people with no bags was all that could fit at one time. The lights in the hall were timed and operated on a button right next to your door on the left on the outside. Just push the button and the lights came on and stayed on well passed your getting into your room. Our room was small (typical for Europe) and we had our own bath with tub/shower. There was a hairdryer in the bath. We had two twin beds that were somewhat smaller than the twin beds in the USA. However, we adjusted just fine and they were comfortable. They had so many warm blankets on them that we had to take the heavy spread off or it was too hot. There was a tv on which we could get CNN. We didn't need any more than that as we were never there. They didn't have an alarm clock but they did have a phone. (I always bring my own little travel clock.) The room also had a safe in the closet. The closet was plenty big enough for a stay longer than ours. It was a delightful, clean and bright room. What our window overlooked I couldn't tell but it was a pleasant view. It was very quiet and we heard no traffic noise. WE ate breakfast there every morning at 6.50E/person. The small dining room downstairs below the lobby was delightful. Breakfast included, a baguette, croissant (delicious) fresh squeezed orange juice (you could hear the machine making the juice) a small jar of plain yoghurt(into which I put one of their tiny jars of strawberry jam) plus a pot of excellent coffee. Butter and little hard lumps of white and raw sugar. Close to the hotel we only found 1 cafe/restaurant that charged this price all the rest were more expensive for the same thing. It was well worth it. The hotel is right off of Rue Cler which is an awesome street with fresh fruit/veg markets, fresh fish, frommerge, wine, chocolate shops as well as sidewalk cafe' and different shops. The walk to the Eiffel Tower took no more than 10 minutes and was a delightful walk. The metro was a 5 minute walk away. The hotel in our opinion was in a great location. Busy during the day yet quiet and safe at night. The owners were very helpful and friendly yet a little aloof(which I understand is normal). I enjoyed talking to them very much but I found that I had to initiate the conversation which was fine. Did we enjoy our stay there, Absolutely. Would we go back, Yes. The cost for the room was 83E/night not including the 13E for the two of us for breakfast. Any further questions please feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, small and close to the Eiffel tower”
Reviews.Author: kimncris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year on the reccommendation of friends. We had no idea where to stay or what to expect in Paris but this hotel was great for the money. The room was small as expected the bathroom and elevator too. The shower water pressure wasn't that great, but it was clean and the room was very affordable, around 90 Euros a night at that time I believe. The staff spoke english and it was really close to the Eiffel tower which was cool for us first timers. Our room overlooked the street on about the 4th or 5th floor so there was some truck noise in the mornings with the Rue Cler market so nearby. There are other parts of the city I like more, and with more restaurants, but it is really close to one of the best: La Fontaine de Mars. We would definitely stay again if we went back to Paris on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world's greatest city”
Reviews.Author: Mr_ZOOM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here many times in the past decade and our stay has always been a sheer pleasure. The rooms are not gigantic but the size is fine unless you're one that must do your jogging in your hotel room. The bed size for 2 seems fine and must be at least a Queen size in the states (never had a problem and I'm over 6 ft tall, not a small guy) The very friendly and helpful english speaking couple that own and run the place (Stephane and Francoise) have been remodeling the rooms and the new ones look fantastic. Everything is very new and clean (even though this hotel has always been spotless) and the totally modern bathrooms with their all white tile and bathtubs are the best - great water pressure and not a speck of dirt. They also have small room fans for the extra warm nights in summer as well as small room safes and in room internet connection if you have your lap top with you. The neighborhood is fantastic with many restaurants close by featuring numerous French, Italian, Chinese, Indian, Japanese, Korean, and many other cusines. 6 days a week Rue Cler (a 10 second walk from the hotel's front door) becomes an all day open air market with a beautiful display of fresh fruits, vegetables, cheese, pastries, meats, fish, flowers, etc. Even though a car sneaks through once in a while this lovely street is meant for walking only. Within a 5 minute walk you will also find the Post Office, a well stocked Magazine/Newspaper/Postcard shop, self service Laundry, Dry Cleaners, more than one Pharmacy, Nice sized Market including Alcohol, A great Wine Shop, The late market that closes around 1am, the Metro, and an intersection that serves 4 main bus routes (2 of the late night ones). The Eiffel Tower is a 10 minute walk and the neighborhood around the Hotel is like going back in time to simpler days. I've been in many hotels all over Paris (from 1 to 5 star) since my first visit in 1977 and nothing tops this Hotel - a Great Find in the Perfect Location. I recommend at least 5 days / 4 nights minimum for your first visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, French, hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnTheBiker
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for four nights in August, 2005. The room was very small, but who stays in the room when in Paris? The owners speak excellent English, and provided excellent suggestions and directions. Our room was next to the elevator, but we didn't notice any annoying noise from it. The hotel is near the Eiffel tower (a 5- 10 minute walk) and the neighborhood is full of nice restaurants and pastry shops. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room, good value”
Reviews.Author: jzisinsd
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and surrounding neighborhood. We stayed for one night on our way home through Paris. Very convenient to Metro station. Room was small but very clean and staff was helpful and friendly. Many eating options close by. Would recommend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We Thoroughly Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: PortRowNYC
Reviews.Content: A very good place to stay and a good price compared to other hotels we considered. Our room was small, but we really didn't spend that much time in it. The bed was comfortable and the room was well tended. We only had the breakfast there once (when there are so many cafes in that neighborhood alone, why eat in your room?), but it was good and a decent price--within .50 euros more or less of most cafes. The staff was friendly and helpful when we needed them. Our room was away from the street with a window that opened up onto a courtyard and very quiet. We would recommend it and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, authentic French family style hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We wanted a very french style hotel in the heart of Paris and we found it here. Gorgeous decor; Provence type prints and colors throughout. Breakfast served in the basement cellar. Very cozy and serving fresh baguettes and criossants from the bakery across the road! We stayed in February 2004 and were very cozy, warm and at peace in this little getaway. It is walking distance to all the museums, close to the Eiffel Tower and all the sights and right on the Rue Cler with its fabulous open air food markets. Opposite is a delightful Bistro. Food, food , food! For 100 euros a night this is a fantastic bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Too small, noisy and rude”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel has such great ratings by Rick Steves and good reviews here, though in the 100's here and I can see why. We just stayed there for 4 nights. The room was not clean-the bathtub had awlful stuff in it, the walls and bathroom door very dirty, don't look under the beds or smell the blankets. Our biggest peeve was that we ordered an airport shuttle different than they advertised at their front desk, our shuttle called the hotel to confirm and the desk clerk cancelled our shuttle. We ended up taking a taxi for 20 euro more. We called our shuttle company and they said that was common because the hotel wants a cut from the shuttle company they advertise. True the location is excellent but there are nearby hotels rated here in the top 10's for not much more. The lobby is cute and the price is low but if only one person can move in the room at a time and the hotel staff are rude there are better places to be.

Reviews.Title: “The little hotel that could...”
Reviews.Author: Jaytee
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place!!! Talk about details. Loved the fabrics and the attention to detail in our little hotel room, near the Eiffel Tower. VERY close to Ecole Militaire metro stop, next to Rue Cler market (I highly recommend getting French strawberries and figs there. It's better than anything I've ever had over here in the States-- and I buy mine from Farmers' Markets!), a post office and couple of great attractions (Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides). One flaw is that this place is filled with tourists, so if you're looking for an authentic experience, don't go to restaurants there. You'll be surrounded by Americans, and servers who speak English and ask if you'd like a non-smoking section, which, as far as I'm concerned, is equivalent to going to "Little Italy" in Chicago or Boston. Take the metro and go to more interesting, less touristy neighborhoods for true French fare and atmosphere. Oh, yea, back to the hotel. GREAT place. Friendly staff, lovely neighborhood. We WILL go back.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average for the Price”
Reviews.Author: CdnGooner
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 32 from July 24 to 30. Very much above average for the very reasonable price. Amenities such as ensuite bathroom and elevator are not common in this price range. Biggest drawback was no A/C, but the fan kept us fairly cool. Room 32 sits over a small terrasse which is very quiet. You can hear birds chirping in the morning. The location of the hotel is top-notch, as other reviewers have mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “Quite an experience...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to the Hotel du Champ du Mars for one night. I stayed on the fifth floor and had an incredible view of the Eiffel Tower (if I leaned my head far enough out of the window). I would agree with most of the reviews, but add one big negative: when someone flushed the toilet in another room, I could hear AND SMELL the result in my bathroom sink. A colleague staying in another room on the fifth floor had the same experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to the olfactory impaired. Otherwise... bring a cork?
